name: panasonic - lumix g7 mirrorless 4k photo digital camera body with 14-42mm f3.5-5.6 ii lens - dmc-g7kk - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment:
this camera is amazing. it's extremely lightweight, shoots in 4k, and has an easy to use interface. 

there's a lot said about the g7 in a hundred different places on the internet, so i'll only reiterate in slight.

for the price point, you get a ton of features. the video quality is pretty much the same as the gh4, so if you want to tighten up your budget and get more accessories, go for this one. you'll lose audio out, and v-log, the metal build of the gh4, weather sealing, 96 fps slow motion shooting, and a few 4k settings, but i have yet to be affected by this. 

if you're just starting, get this. worry less about your equipment and pixels and audio and going crazy spending dollars on the best of the best. worry more about the movie you want to make, your vision.

review_comment: excellent quality camera with lots of features for the beginners. some of the features might not be useful for beginners but they are good to have once they become expert in photography.

name: canon - eos 5d mark iv dslr camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body Only
review_comment:
wow. just wow. 
don't listen to the haters commenting about 4k video etc.. this camera works great, and the 4k video, is very good. i am sure that if you are a pro videographer - you'll be looking at a dedicated video camera - but for me it works just fine.
two tips - make sure to format all your memory cards in exfat to prevent the video's being broken into 4gb segments. and the camera when recording to 4k - does produce huge files that will need to be processed down into more manageable video codec. handbrake works great for that.

review_comment: i purchased this camera after reading and viewing many positive reviews. it certainly is feature packed for the price point - ibis, weather sealing, 4k video and still modes, built in flash, built in interval shooting, internal flash, etc. the main reason i returned it was because the body felt cheap and plasticky. it certainly did not feel as stout as the sonys, olympuses (?) and fuji cameras in and around the same price point. although it is weather sealed, i really wondered if it would stand up to my frequent trips to the beach and trails. also, while the video was fantastic, the pics were so-so. i believe they'd be much better with a better lens, but i didn't feel like spending another $1k for a mfts 2.8. i may return to the brand, though, after the gh5 is released.

review_comment: this camera is super light weight! even comes with lense kit and awesome manual for reference if your a beginner like me. this camer is like the best out there for it's price point. i'm a youtube guy my channel is deon 0026 i make fish videos and vlog. the 4k is real! i know you have modern technology, like cell phones... hehe so do i! but. this is like so many more shots per second it intensified ever video and quality was unreal! if you don't believe me check out my channel and look how awesome it's doing ! it's also tons of research and resources on youtube to help you be a pro with out reading the manual!! hehe. sorry i'm not big on instructions i like youtube. so it's touch screen. easy to navigate with touch or buttons that's fairly labeled. and it has a decent built in mic so to add one like i did was optional. i recommend this camer to any pro or beginner. you have the option to have swivel the 3.5 inch screen any direction you'd like! so selfies just got real haha. it's like 40+ picture modes. burst shooting etc. now the lense kit come with it is awesome but i think i'm going upgrade to catch bugs on trees without being so close lol. i'm like into photography now. like my youtube saying yickadee holla

review_comment: i am a professional photographer and upgraded from a 5d mark ii. all the new features added to this camera are amazing. plus, using best buy’s credit line i was able to upgrade with the means to pay this camera off over 18 months.

name: panasonic - lumix g7 mirrorless 4k photo digital camera body with 14-42mm f3.5-5.6 ii lens - dmc-g7kk - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment:
i’ll start by saying i got the open box version during the pre christmas sale making this only $399. at that price it was no contest as to what camera to buy. i did get this primarily for video. it is extremely strong at providing beautiful video and pretty darn decent low light video. the biggest problem with low light being the autofocus. it can be quite atrocious focusing in low light. lots of hunting even when what your subject is staying in one focal plane. this can be avoided by focusing once and then switching to manual focus. this won’t cause too much of a problem for me since i will be using it for mostly planned shots of short duration without needing too much autofocus. 
however in brighter lighting it works much better. and since auto and manual focus can be toggled so easy for t can be worked around in low light as well.

as fa as photography, i do not have a lot of experience on that end. since i went with a mirror less camera instead of a camcorder i plan on getting into it a little more since i have a nice little camera for photography now, but i can’t really say how it performs other than it’s obvioualy much better that any point and shoot if used in the past. 
at the price this sells at. (constantly changing between 599 and 799 typically i’d choose this over others in its price range. if you need autofocus to be spot on all the time it sounds like canon has the best in that regards. you will just have to stick to 1080 video then. which isn’t a problem. i will be outputting everything at 1080 anyway. it’s juat really handy to be able to crop all my shots down to 1/4 size and still retain 1080 resolution to give me ultimate flexibility.

name: nikon - d7500 dslr 4k video camera with af-s dx nikkor 18-140mm f/3.5-5.6g ed vr lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body & Lens
review_comment: all came as expected. received it on time and complete.

name: panasonic - lumix g7 mirrorless 4k photo digital camera body with 14-42mm f3.5-5.6 ii lens - dmc-g7kk - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: such a amazing 4k video camera for the price!
review_comment:
everything about this camera is out there on the internet so theres no need for me to explain it in detail in specs wise. but from my personal experience while using it, the g7 blew my mind in overall quality and performance that i got for what ive paid for it. it was on sale for such a even great price! i have made a vlog using the g7 and uploaded it on youtube if you are curious about the video quality. the video is amazing although you wont get any professional features like the gh5 but for casual user like my self, this camera should be more than enough! 
now since i didnt really play around too much with the photo performance i cannot really tell if the g7 is a great camera for pictures or not but ive shot some pictures with it and i was pretty happy with the result. i tried manual then auto both resulting in good pictures as is without post editing. now the cons about this camera to me are only the build quality and the pretty slow auto fucusing when shooting video, but those are not enough reasons for me to not giving this camera 5 star. they say you get what you pay for but for me, i got more then what ive paid for this little amazing camera to be honest. not too long after i purchased the g85 came out! so unfortunatelly i had to exchange it with the g85 ( thank you best buy for the hassle free return policy that cannot be beat!!) just because of its 5 axis in body stabilization which is amazing! well now thats going to be another review i suppose!lol
if you can find this camera for a discounted price or on sale and you are looking for your very first camera for mainly video rather than photos get this! if you care so much more about photo than video, well maybe this camera is not for you look for canon or nikon or even sony cameras. good luck and have a great day!

name: panasonic - lumix g7 mirrorless 4k photo digital camera body with 14-42mm f3.5-5.6 ii lens - dmc-g7kk - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: neat camera with gps location sync
review_comment: it's a neat camera, and it's great to have access to the entire range of micro four-thirds lenses. but my favourite feature is the syncing of location data from a smartphone (https://photo.stackexchange.com/questions/87059/image-app-gps-how-does-it-work) -- you start logging your location in the lumix app on your smartphone, take the photos you want, then sync location data to your camera to tag photos with geographical coordinates of where you were when those photos were taken. great feature to help organize photos!

name: nikon - d850 dslr 4k video camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body Only
review_comment: the nikon d850 is possibly the best camera available for pros or amateurs wanting the larger file size as well as the lower cost compared to the d5.

name: canon - eos 5d mark iv dslr camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body Only
review_title: best camera for your buck to date
review_comment:
if you are just getting into dslrs and comparing canon 5d mark iv with others, go with canon. for the price, you will not get a better camera. you may be able to find a comparable one but it will not be as good! make sure to get c log through canon if your camera did not have it when you bought it. 
make sure pair your camera with one of the l lenses canon has. it does not have to be top of the line l. start with canon 24-105mm f/4l one of the best overall lenses canon has ever made! 
let me know if you have any questions about this camera (or others) and lenses.

name: sony - cyber-shot rx10 iv 20.1-megapixel digital camera - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Point & Shoot Cameras
review_title: better camera then i’m a photographer
review_comment: i really believe in this camera. i am having trouble with the auto focus thing with this but i think it’s my understanding of it, and settings. i’ll get it down. it’s just a learning curve.

name: nikon - d850 dslr 4k video camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body Only
review_comment:
best dslr on the market at the moment. don't hesitate, get one if you're interested. just make sure you use quality glass. you'll love the images you get from this new sensor. just make sure your technique is good as the high mp sensor will show all flaws.
buffer is something that i'm not too happy about. shooting in 14 bits uncompressed raw will give u about 20-30 images, nowhere near the # nikon showed. change it to 12bits, this # will jump to 40-50. if you dont mind then its the only way to go.

make sure you use an xqd card and a fast sd. it worth it.

review_comment: the camera is a great way to achieve a nostalgic look in photographs. it's not digital, and there isn't a display screen. there is no menu, delete button or playback. it's the easiest camera you'll ever use. the negatives need to be developed before you can see the images. the image quality is best when used in daylight. i love these cameras.

name: nikon - d850 dslr 4k video camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body Only
review_comment: this camera is the best hd-slr you will find on the market now. it feels and acts like my d500 but make no mistake, this camera with its 46mp will show any deficiency in your technique as camera blurr. this is the best of the best and well worth stepping up my game for. once i slowed down and payed attention to technique i got fantastic results! wow is the best word to describe this camera!

review_comment: this camera...my goodness. if you’re looking at this review the chances are you’ve probably heard a lot about this camera. just know that this camera will be good no matter what. for probably 98% of photographers and even videographers this will be perfect. i could go on and on about this camera but i’m short on time. just know...if you have the budget, this is absolutely the best value, no question.

name: sony - alpha a7 iii mirrorless 4k video camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras

name: sony - cyber-shot rx10 iv 20.1-megapixel digital camera - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Point & Shoot Cameras
review_comment:
earlier this year i bought a sony a6500 camera at best buy and it is awesome!!! the one big thing that i don't really like about it is having to switch lenses constantly.

enter the rx10 iv: i no longer have to switch lenses. the built in zoom lens is *sharp* even at the 600mm end! the phase detection auto focus is fast and accurate just like the advertisement says. and the built in image stabilization works great too.

in regards to recording in 4k, i've had no problems with overheating, which unfortunately happens with the a6500 every now and then.

the only things that i'd like to see improvement in a future rx10 v would be:

(1) no 4k video at 60fps
(2) i wish it had at least 24mp of resolution
(3) no built in neutral density filters
(4) no way to reprogram the zoom ring to simply do nothing. (i sometimes bump the darn thing every now and then when i'm using the manual focus ring)
(5) dual memory card slots. let's face it, some of us will be using this camera in semi critical/critical applications. having backup memory is important.

*

image quality is beautiful, good in low light, dynamic range is unreal. i put this bad boy through rigorous use every other weekend, i am a busy wedding photographer and it keeps going. get it if you can, if you get this and your images don't look like you want, then you know the issue is you and you can easily improve, but you won't know what to improve if you are hiding behind inferior products.

name: panasonic - lumix g85 mirrorless 4k photo digital camera body with 12-60mm lens, dmc-g85mk - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: i was skeptical, but it has high quality and value
review_comment:
i went in to buy sony a7ii when it was on sale. a7ii sold out. with trepidation, i bought this panasonic camera. 

with the price tag, i did not expect much. i was wrong. i am so happy that i the sony was sold out. 
i 've had this for weeks now and the ease of use with the touch screen, the video quality, the battery life. 

i have not shot in low light yet but the iso with the 12-60mm lens is up to par. 16 mp is great and provides great resolution when i edit pictures on my ipad pro. 

it's winter now and so far i have not felt the need to buy a new lens (i am mostly shooting street photography and portraits). 

the only downside is that it has only 1 sd card slot...(i bought a 128 gb sd card to compensate...still single point of failure though)

the best part of this camera is the video. i am shooting w/o 4k, but boy, it looks professional w/o edit! auto-focus is on point for day shoot. i've reverted to manual focus when i was shoting at night. 

call it serendipity.

review_title: great image quality / poor ergonomics & ui
review_comment: this is a hard camera for me to review. i like it a lot but it has some minor issues that hold it back from being awesome in my opinion. the image quality and auto focus are great for the style of shooting i prefer. i generally shoot studio and location portraits. however, the camera ergonomics and user interface feel like someone that has never used a camera before designed them. expect to buy a battery charger at an additional $88 because the camera does not come with one. the in-body usb battery charging is painfully slow. other than that, the camera is fine and a solid 4 out of 5 stars.

review_comment:
my older sony 5nex stopped working. i debated for a long time if i wanted to get another sony bc i do love canon as i always liked the way color came out on their cameras better. but eventually ended up getting one as i already had the longer zoom lens and this camera is more compact. 

debated between this and the a6000. am so glad i spent the extra money to get this camera that was more expensive as it had the better lens and slightly more features than the other version. i took pics during a musical for my nephew. it was extremely dark and i didn't use a flash and the pictures turned out great! and the color and clarity are excellent. also used my longer lens for a college graduation. it captures motion/movement better than my previous camera - i used to have a lot of blurry pics before. so far i've only used it a few times - but very happy with results. very easy for amateur to use. i am a bit of a lazy photog and mostly use auto focus.

review_comment: i love this camera! it is not perfect but perfect for my needs. i could list so many good things but instead i will list a few things i love about this camera. shoots in 4k, shoots 1080p @ 120 fps, has a flip screen for seeing myself while filming youtube videos, touch tracking for shooting events and first ever camera with no recording limits plus it has a microphone jack for better audio. the sony a6400 camera is definitely advanced with so many features/options like color profiles. i love it!! if you’re looking for a great event videography/youtube/vlogging/photography i think this will be perfect!! especially for the price. bang for buck there is nothing else on the market that can top this!!! thank me later!

name: sony - alpha a6400 mirrorless camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment:
the a6400 replaced an a6000, which i was very pleased with.  i upgraded to the a6400 because of the advances in af, mainly the addition of tracking and both human and animal eye focus.  the animal eye focus feature does, at this point, require a simple online firmware update.

the pros with this camera are it’s compact size and light weight, its excellent sony aps-c sensor, very usable evf, very good low light performance, and overall fine image quality.  that, plus the advanced af features, make for a formidable little camera.

the downside is that it may be too small for larger hands, and definitely does not balance well with larger, heavier lenses.  although improved, sony menus are not what i would call intuitive.  the manual that comes with the camera is very basic, and really leaves much to the new owner to figure things out.  also, as with most mirrorless designs, battery life is relatively poor.

so, if you're looking for a carry camera that doesn’t require a padded shoulder strap because of its weight, and want the image quality of an aps-c sensor, the a6400 may be a perfect fit.  just expect to spend some time with the menus, and a lot of time online figuring out how to set it up so you can take advantage of its many features.

name: nikon - z50 mirrorless 4k video camera with nikkor z dx 16-50mm f/3.5-6.3 vr lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: pleasantly surprised by this solid little camera!
review_comment:
after four years, my trusty d5300 was long in the shutter count tooth and in need of replacing. i debated the merits of going full frame, ultimately choosing the z50 because its more compact size leads to easier travel. i have to say i’m super happy with the purchase. 

pros: the evf is incredible; i will never go back to an optical viewfinder. eye autofocus and tracking are good (not awesome) but acceptable enough for me to shoot a high school hockey game with ease. all my nikon lenses work flawlessly with the ftz adapter. battery life is better than expected. lightweight, well built, but ergonomically comfortable. great option for video. handles noise at higher isos better than i though it would, being an aps-c camera. weather sealing feels good. 

cons: good thing the ftz adapter works well because there’s bupkis available for fast z glass. (seriously, nikon?!) lightroom can be a bit finicky with the exported files. eye autofocus system is not as accurate as sony’s. menu can be a bit much to navigate. kit lens is disappointing. 

overall, i would definitely recommend this little camera. i can see it becoming my go to travel camera.

name: nikon - d850 dslr 4k video camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body Only
review_comment: i am a seasoned wedding photographer in the houston, tx area, and previously shot all weddings with a d750. after upgrading to the d850, my only regret is not having done so sooner! this body is incredibly fast, works wonders in low light, and the images are the sharpest i've ever seen. i paired it with the 58mm f1.4 nikon lens, and it is absolutely amazing. totally recommend this for professional photographers. it is worth the investment!

name: sony - cyber-shot rx100 vii 20.1-megapixel digital camera - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Point & Shoot Cameras
review_comment:
the rx100 cameras are always excellent cameras.  i have owned quite a few of them.  this one is an improvement.  autofocus is fast.  the lens seems to be very sharp, and i feel that the sony colors are getting better and better.  if you read books on how to use the camera, you would not believe all of the "advanced" features it has.  
the small optional grip that can be attached to the camera provides a better feel -giving you a better hold.
i compared the same photos i took with a micro four thirds and apsc camera, and i really don't see much of a difference in image quality (especially sharpness).
it's a great very pocketable travel camera.  what's good also is that it's deceiving.  people that are not knowledgeable would not realize how high end it is.

name: canon - eos rebel t7 dslr video two lens kit with ef-s 18-55mm and ef 75-300mm lenses - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body & Lens
review_comment:
the camera is rock solid. the pictures and videos it takes are terrific. where more tech is needed, is removing, primarily videos off of the camera. you need to download a clunky canon application to your smart phone which does a nice job of moving images from the camera to your phone, but moving videos is painful. 
after spend a great deal of time trying to move the video files to no avail, i ended up removing the sd card, fire up my old macbook pro (my one doesn't have the slot anymore) and transferred the file from the card directly to my mb pro. clunky, clunky, clunky. 
if you're primarily using it for pictures, you're in great shape. if you want it for videos, you may want to keep looking or keep your fingers crossed that canon improves its software.
one more issue. the camera will only record video for 30 mins. after that timeframe it shuts down. you have to be ready to start it back up if you're recording for a longer period of time. food for thought.

name: sony - cyber-shot rx100 vii 20.1-megapixel digital camera - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Point & Shoot Cameras
review_title: the rx100 is a high-end point and shoot camera
review_comment:
you will want to take this everywhere. it takes sharp pictures with brilliant color the zeiss zoom now reaches 200mm. it has a touch screen and there is a pop-up viewfinder if you want to use it. both focusing and writing to memory card is fast. this is the seventh iteration - hence the vii. it has evolved into a superb camera. 
some dislikes: it came without a handgrip -why? sony probably saved 2 cents on each camera and i looked at two $20 addons that weren’t satisfactory. it’s tough without the grip. small and slippery like a bar of soap. the little doors to access usb etc are cheap plastic junk-very easy to snap off. no raw (!).  sony menus are not intuitive. the on/off button is recessed but is easy to turn on when you put the camera in your pocket. needs a safety or lock. if accidentally activated in your pocket the zoom tries to open.

name: canon - eos 90d dslr camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body Only
review_comment: my new canon eos 90d dslr camera (body only) is a tremendous upgrade from my earlier canon eos 06d with double the megapixel resolution, a better and easier to use tilt-able lcd screen, now featuring touch control.  but the best feature is the 90d's continuous auto focus capability with face recognition and focus tracking.  this is such an advantage for video recording  and a huge step forward from the 60d, which required manual focusing when recording video.  as a result, my video recordings are now smooth and without the movement artifact caused by manipulating the lens's focus ring during shooting.  plus, i can use the canon lenses i already owned from my 60d purchase on my new 90d body.

name: canon - eos 90d dslr camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body Only
review_title: robust & powerful but ultimately returned it
review_comment:
unfortunately i found the 90d to have poor performance in low light with noticeable noise anywhere above 1000 iso.  compared to my canon rp it was quite significant.  moreover, i immediately found my myself in need of maf or calibration of the lens to match the 90d, another issue not found in my rp.

after 1000 shots i felt it was best to return it & invest in something more complementary.  however, i think the 90d has a lot of potential as a classical dslr, that it felt more robust & to size than a mirrorless.  as a former owner of the 70d & 80d i think the 90d is the culmination of previous models & fairly advanced.  for me i had already moved into full frame sensors & mirrorless so it was nostalgia mixed with caution

name: sony - alpha a6400 mirrorless camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment: i was looking at an a6000 and was advised by a much more knowledgeable friend to “buy once, cry once,” and i am glad i did. this body has excellent build quality, an excellent sensor, and many more bells and whistles than my novice mind can understand. however, shooting in manual mode with most of the electronic aids disabled is a breeze. iso, shutter speed, and aperture are all at your fingertips and adjust intuitively. i have shot with both a sony 3.5-5.6/18-55 and a sony 4.5-6.3/55-210. detail is very crisp (as long as your hands are steady). and a shutter speed of around 1/320 eliminates all motion blur from my dogs tearing around the yard. after about 2000 shutter clicks, i am very pleased with this camera body. now i need to invest in some better glass to really get the most out of the camera.

name: sony - alpha a6400 mirrorless 4k video camera with e 18-135mm f/3.5-5.6 oss lens - black

name: nikon - coolpix p950 16.0-megapixel digital camera - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Point & Shoot Cameras
review_comment: this camera produces nice image quality in good light. stabilization is impressive. zoom is super long. snap back zoom feature is really helpful when zooming long distance. to my surprise, program mode is excellent. raw is a nice feature but jpeg out of camera is very good. nice viewfinder for a bridge camera. button layout is good. anything over 800 iso is not recommended, 100-400 is best but wasn't expecting anything different from a small sensor camera. lens is a marvel, blows my mind at the image quality at the long end. when you get into the digital zoom, make sure to use a sturdy tripod, cable release (or timer function) and turn off vibration reduction in menu, for optimal image quality. the lens hood is a bonus and needed. the camera is light, easy to use, and with a little practice, you will get consistently good results.

name: canon - eos rebel t7 dslr video camera with 18-55mm lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body & Lens
review_comment: i used this camera with the new "webcam utility app". this camera takes on a whole new ability when you sync it up with the canon webcam utility, and the connect app, either on your ipad or pc desktop. i was totally amazed by the quality that this camera was able to do, once canon's preset settings took over. i thought i had things in focus, but the canon webcam utility app and the remote shooting took this camera to another level. i was able to run it remotely without a usb cable, nor a "capture card". i was able to use the "remote shooting" app to fine tune the camera features and record remotely. the only down side would be that you will have to possibly change the batteries if the camera goes to sleep. but i think by now, someone has figured out how to bypass that drawback. the batteries will definitely run a good hour, but i was using it in a streaming setup, and not recording on board. i am pretty sure that the batteries would have probably ran down quicker if had been recording onboard. the availbility of being able to record with the "remote shooting" has been around, but using it wirelessly was definitely a "major plus". no extra cable to have people tripping over while you are on a shoot.

name: sony - cyber-shot rx100 vii 20.1-megapixel digital camera - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Point & Shoot Cameras
review_comment: i am just beginning to learn how to use this. i do feel like there is a lot to learn before i get really good pictures with this. i had a panasonic lumix compact zoom years ago when they first started making them (2006 or so?). i feel like i was able to get good pictures on auto without knowing what i am doing. this one i feel like i am going to have to take some classes to get good pictures. it could just be that my subjects have changed from flowers and dogs that would stay on command to a busy toddler, but i am having a hard time figuring out how to get good (not blurry) pictures. i had eventually planned on learning more about photography so had wanted to get something with a decent zoom  that i could use now on auto and that would have settings i could learn how to use later. i don’t want to take too many stars off since it is probably still a really good camera if you know how to use it. i don’t know if i would recommend it, but an experienced photographer probably shouldn’t be looking for my recommendation.

review_comment: the camera is amazing. day and night improvement over 5d mark iv. the focus tracking is just ridiculously fast and on point. camera is worth every penny. i mostly shoot video and yes the camera does have heating issues in 8k but you are missing the point. this gives you an option of 8k for a price point well below the red and black magic. if you are shooting high end movies, commercials and documentary this is not designed for that there is eos cinema line for that. you can't have everything for 4 thousand dollars so please stop complaining. its designed for professional consumers for weddings, photography and everyday people in mind. i haven't had any issues yet and i shot ton of video ranging from weddings to commercial work. it was definetely worth the wait. dont forget to buy the rf lenses there is nothing that can match them out there right now. they are bit expensive but hey you don't buy them every year. they are there for a long time.

name: "samsung - 32"" class m4500 series led hd smart tizen tv (2018)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_title: great tv overall, tuner is just mediocre.
review_comment: overall it's a legit quality tv. preset picture is good and just set sound to amplified and it was ideal. basic stuff for inputs, but that's all i need. tuner on the other hand is just ok. i've had more than enough tv's paired with a variety of antennas and i know when i'm using a quality antenna vs a cheapo model. even with one of the best and most expensive and well reviewed antennas this tv does only about half as well at picking up channels that other tv's i've had have gotten in the exact same area when paired with quality antennas. i'm not saying the tuner is all together bad, it's just a comparative thing that it falls short. hey, if you want this for it's smart features and/or will be hooking up a cable or satellite box to it then this absolutely a 5 star tv all day, but if you're looking for one that when paired with a quality antenna will perform as well as most other brands, then this falls short in that category. that i'm using it for local broadcasting means that i have to account for this and sorry but i have to knock a star off for the fact that comparably it has one of the lowest performing tuners i've seen since digital tuners started being used.

name: sony - alpha 7s iii full-frame mirrorless camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment:
i recently used this camera for a low-light film project and cannot put into words how incredible it is, but i’ll try: the new flip out screen is beyond welcome; the updated location of the recording button is honestly one of the best additions; and, of course, its impeccable ability to capture the night sky is second to none. as a member of the sony alpha imaging collective, i’ve been fortunate enough to test quite a bit of awesome gear, but this camera feels like it’s in a league of its own. it has all of the same fantastic features seen in previous sony mirrorless cameras, but the updates in the a7s iii are so huge that it made me feel a little blue every time i had to grab an a7 iii instead of this camera while filming the project. even with the iso cranked up to 102,400 (its highest native iso), footage still looks spectacular.

it feels very lightweight in hand, and i appreciate the new menu. it seemed overwhelming at first, but the larger focus on colors really leaves a lasting impression; i now know where each of my most-changed items are instinctively by color, which makes similar items so much easier to find in comparison to sony's previous menu. 

being able to record raw is massive, especially when filming hard to capture night sky phenomena such as aurora borealis. my dream of becoming a superhero basically came true—this camera comes with night vision. i am still in disbelief that i was able to point this small camera at the night sky and record stars and swirling aurora. 

while the a7s iii was largely created for video, the photo capabilities are pleasantly surprising. as an astrophotographer, i am thrilled to have this in my toolbox for stills as well. i honestly cannot recommend this baby enough. if you shoot at night, then no questions asked. this is the champ.

category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment: from what i experimented with this camera is great. easy to use. you cam move back an for with the lenses with the adapter. save you money.  these camera are the future. they’ll only get better.

name: canon - eos rebel t7 dslr video two lens kit with ef-s 18-55mm and ef 75-300mm lenses - black

review_comment:
good beginner and entry level camera for photography. i wouldn't even bother with the video recording mode, it's pretty garbage, especially the internal mic. it is nice to have two interchangeable lenses and a case. 
with that being said, if you are looking for a camera for youtube recording purposes, or vlogging, pass on this camera. i will be returning mine because 1. it doesn't have a flip out screen (which was ok when i first bought it) 2. the camera does not support trs microphones, so it is impossible to connect an external mic. 3. quality for cost seems unbalanced.

name: canon - eos r5 mirrorless camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment: this camera is a total game changer. i upgraded from a 6d and i cannot be more thrilled. i am primarily an equestrian photographer and also do maybe 6 weddings/elopements per year. the eye tracking for animals and humans makes my keep rate 95%. it's so nice not having to overshoot to still have some photos miss the focus slightly. it keeps up with fast paced horses who are constantly moving. i shot at a horse show in a partially covered arena (horrible, horrible, light) and it was able to track the focus even with my subject 150ft away, and still be sharp. i do not have any rf lenses yet and use the adapter with my canon ef lenses and sigma art 135mm. the only downfall (and i mean only downfall) is the battery life. i will be investing in a few more batteries and battery grip soon, just for weddings.

category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body Only
review_comment:
upgraded from a 60d and we're glad we did. first of all, the construction of the body is much more durable. handling the camera is natural, great ergonomics.

image quality is great. my wife has noticed the drastic change in quality from the 60d. she is the photographer, i'm the videographer. the video quality really impressed me and encouraged me to build a 4k editing rig. the follow focus function is seemless and the quality is good enough for commercial production.

drive mode is also impressive, the shots per second allow for some great action photos, crucial for wildlife photography.

review_title: wow!! i got to learn a lot more to be comfortable
review_comment: at first, i was kinda disappointed in the camera having no flip up flash. but after realizing the exceptional abilities of the advanced iso improvements, it didn't really matter.  it's awesome. my last purchase was a nikon 800, so i was expecting controls and menu selections to be mostly the same. however, the new focusing system and the extent of its capabilities create so many menu differences that it was like it required a whole new study to fully understand and utilize the capabilities of what it can do. i am still in the process of learning a lot of this stuff, but as i am learning i find out more and more how this camera is steps above what i have been used to. now i just gotta put my nose to the grindstone and enter this new world. i am anxious, but confident, to see just how much my photography will improve.

review_title: best mirrorless video camera on the market!
review_comment:
the absolute best low light camera i've ever used. even at higher iso, the clarity beats any canon i've ever used. the video is smooth and clean. rolling shutter is basically non existent.

the color is much more natural straight out of camera, and while not as neutral as canon, i almost like it better. 

the new menu and flip out screen changes everything! 

10/10. i'll have this camera for many years to come.

review_title: i don't miss my nikon anymore
review_comment:
i've been using this nifty cam for a few days now and i must admit, zooming in to the pictures taken with this always comes as a surprise.

it feels so much like an old point and shoot cam, that the final quality of the pictures is such a pleasant surprise. 

i'm still getting used to the limited controls on the cam, and customizing it to my needs. there are still some nikon controls that i miss at times which at times i find it hard to find - but i suppose that's just me getting used to a new camera system

name: panasonic - lumix g7 mirrorless 4k photo digital camera body with 14-42mm f3.5-5.6 ii lens - dmc-g7kk - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment: i am a complete amateur when it comes to camera and photography, but i wanted a good camera for streaming and video. after reading many reviews and looking at cameras in my budget, i decided on the lumix g7. so far, this has been a great camera, and i’m satisfied with the video quality. there is a bit of a learning curve as the dslr have many different settings, but it’s nothing you can’t learn from one of the many youtube videos about the g7. if you are going for photography, you may want to look into other options, though this camera isn’t bad at taking pictures by any stretch. where this camera can flex, though, is in its 4k video and streaming capabilities. i had this camera recommended to me, and i would definitely recommend to others for high quality, yet affordable streaming. bear in mind that in order to use this camera as a webcam, you will also need to purchase something like the elgato camlink and an hdmi-to-microhdmi cable. you will also want to invest in a power supply so as to not be constantly running on the camera battery. happy streaming!

name: canon - eos rebel t7 dslr video two lens kit with ef-s 18-55mm and ef 75-300mm lenses - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body & Lens
review_title: great images, plenty of options, nice lenses
review_comment:
this camera has been great so far.  in particular, when taking pictures of birds from 30-40' away, it captures clear images with good detail and sharp colors.  

i am no professional photographer, but the features serve my needs well so far, and there is still a lot to explore.  in particular, i like the lenses this camera kit comes with.  i may expand to a higher zoom lens at some point, but the kit works well as a good starter for a person who wants great results without an advanced knowledge of photography.  this camera also seems to have plenty of control options for more advanced photography, and the cannon eos rebel series comes highly recommended.  

the t7i has some additional features, but those features come with a price, and for my needs, this kit has been a great buy.

for a professional, the full size sensor would probably be a must, but for anything outside of that, this budget friendly kit is hard to beat.

review_comment: i really like how nice the pictures come out. different settings do help a lot especially lighting on certain categories. recording is not so good, it only focuses up close and when ever you zoom in and out while recording is doesn't focus well and you appear blurry. it's more of a picture on picture camera more than recording. not bad for my 1st eos. i have enjoyed it and practiced. great quality on portraits and pro settings. the landscape setting is perfect for outdoor areas , especially where there is a lot of greenery.  upclose shot is awesome for flowers, small insects. i dont like that it doesn't zoom in much for the lens that it has

sony prime lens. the kit lens is really good but the prime lenses are better.

name: nikon - z 6 ii 4k video mirrorless camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: amazing camera. not using the term lightly.
review_comment: i love this camera! yeah, it's pricey, but i really do not regret it. photos are sharp. the camera is snappy. i had nikon for 33 years, digital since 2001 and i finally have this same feeling of shooting film with a digital camera - with, of course the additional benefits of digital. and i am still discovering this amazing baby... i now need to name her!

review_comment:
i purchased this camera to replace a busted "high-end" webcam (logitech) and step up my video call game. i have to say, spending the extra $$$ on this dslr over a webcam was worth every penny. the difference is night and day. not to mention the ability to changes lens to get add much more versatility and value.

a must-buy for anyone tired of looking like a blurry mess on video calls.

review_comment: i have been a faithful samsung tv customer for at least two decades now and unfortunately, this purchase has been my first dud. the mechanism that reads the wifi signal on this device simply is not strong enough to read the wifi in any house. as a result, the customer must reset the tv every time you turn it on. to make matters worse, i bought this tv for my daughter, so i didn't set it up right away. when i took it back to best buy they would not accept it because it was after 14 days.... i took it back 24 days later. so now i am stuck with a tv that i have to reset every time i use it.

review_comment: i did months of research on this camera before i bought it and it does not disappoint! i'm not a professional photographer/videographer but i've been a hobbyist for quite some time now. this takes incredible photos and video! it's not cheap certainly and the lenses are pricy as well, but the outcome is worth it. crystal clear photos/videos and amazing memories. i love this camera and its features.

review_title: great camera at a reasonable price
review_comment: as a long time nikon user, i decided to make the move from a crop sensor dslr to a full frame mirrorless camera. i spent a couple of months researching several cameras for the features i wanted and at a reasonable price. the z6ii was what i preferred but it was out of my price range. the z5 is an amazing camera and i am very pleased with the performance and quality of images in getting. i recommend anyone getting in to full frame mirrorless to start with this.

review_comment: i’ve used every camera system and i’ve ended up here. having the processor of a more expensive camera (1dxmkiii) coupled with a 45mp sensor that shoots as fast as sports cameras makes this thing a beast.

name: panasonic - lumix s5 mirrorless full frame camera body with 20-60mm f3.5-5.6 lens - dc-s5kk - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment: this camera is such a gem. amazing full frame sensor. basically a full framer gh5. except its lighter than a gh5 and its usually right around the same price. kit lens is actually really good. not as good some high end leica glass but pretty impressive. the fact that this camera and lens regularly are on sale for around 2 grand  is one of the better buys you can make in the mirrorless market. if your willing to deal with 2 things. the auto focus system, while being totally usable, is not as good or as fast a sony or a canon. and the selection of lenses for the l mount system isnt nearly as vast as sony. if those 2 things arent mission critical to you then this is the best 2000 dollar camera on the whole market. 6k 10 bit 60 fps 422 video recording externally!! without overheating, looking at you sony, or time limited. is simply unbeatable. if you watched bo burnhams "inside" it was filmed on the s1h which is just this things bigger brother. same sensor ,same video format same lenses. in short incredible for anyone looking to take incredible video or stills.

name: canon - eos rebel t7 dslr video camera with 18-55mm lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body & Lens
review_comment:
this was a great purchase that i have had to make for a class. i love how this camera is better than my phone's camera. i did have trouble with the manual mode as you have to adjust the settings depending on your surroundings. as i got used to the adjustments i was able to take amazing pictures with it. the creative mode was the best feature because it did everything for me which was an easy setting for fast quick pictures and the blur in the background was effective and made my pictures stand out.  
i do wish that the camera came with a lens that allowed me to zoom in more than the one it had come with. i was not able to use the app that this camera suggests and it would have been helpful to use the app instead of taking my sim card out of the camera. i think that if you take it in and out a lot it can wear out the area. it would freeze a lot and i was not able to go through the camera's photos, which leads me to wish that i was able to access and take photos through my phone as they have advertised.

name: sony - alpha 7r iii full-frame interchangeable lens 42.4 mp mirrorless camera - body only - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment:
i was coming from a regular a7 (mark 1) and this has blown my mind.

comfort wise is way better to hold in your hand (that extra size of the grip is noticeable). button layout is very convenient (though i had no big issues with the old one in that regard). the joystick is very handy to help with the focus.

then when it comes to the sensor, it is a huge step. the difference from 24 to 42 megapixels is incredible.

focus speed is much faster (specially autofocus) than my old camera.

probably there is people who can find the faults and limitations of this camera but i cannot. this camera is way above my skills ;)

name: sony - alpha 7c full-frame compact mirrorless camera with fe 28-60mm f4-5.6 lens - silver
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment: extremely compact lens and camera body with amazing quality. the camera was amazing to learn the ins and outs of photography. i bought this camera right before a road trip and was amazed by the amount of settings and capabilities such a small camera could possess. shutter speed dial is a little odd but just press the bottom button on the thumb dial that’s facing you on the back of the camera and spin the dial, other than that its a very nice camera i intend to use for a while. all the pictures uploaded were taken with this camera/ lens combo and edited in lightroom.

name: nikon - d850 dslr 4k video camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body Only
review_comment:
i did a lot of research prior to purchasing this camera. i wanted a usa warranty. i found many grey market cameras online that were cheaper but for a few more dollars for this purchase to me it was worth it. 
i have had the chance to take about 1000 shots with it, the quality of the photos at higher iso is great. very fast. i have used nikon in the past and absolutely love this camera. it is a little heavy and i could have gone with a mirror less for less weight but i already have a good collection of quality lens and didn’t want to start over with that. if you compare the weight difference it’s not that much between the mirror less and this camera. if you purchase i don’t think you will be disappointed.
best buy has always been fast delivery, the packaging could have been a little better.

category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras

review_title: with a few upgrades the s5 becomes a powerhouse
review_comment: incredibly happy with my s5 which has been used mostly in a studio environment recording videos. i did make a significant upgrade to its capabilities by adding an atomos ninja v, which i highly recommend if you plan to use it for video. my main complaint at the moment is the apparent lack of accuracy from the in-camera level gauge. not even panasonic has been able to tell me the tolerances so far, but i have had my case escalated and am waiting to hear back regarding this issue. aside from that, i've purchased a fotodiox pro ef-l adapter and a canon 16-35mm f2.8 lens (very lightly used) for much less than the panasonic pro lens (which is only f4, i believe) and i couldn't be happier with the results.

name: sony - alpha 7 iv full-frame mirrorless interchangeable lens camera - (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: frustrating and amazing at the same time.
review_comment:
this is pretty much about it's video capabilities. i mainly bought this camera for video but wanted to have a good camera for photos as well. coming from a gh5s the sony a7 iv is pretty amazing. better video quality, excellent autofocus and man that shallow depth of field is pretty special with my f2.8 16-35mm lens. no focus breathing is pretty special too. low light is really exceptional even when i tested it against an a7s iii that i almost bought.  the color is really good and i like how the colors seem more true to what you are filming  in a rec709 setting vs my gh5s, the gh5 and gh5 ii i tested against it. i like it much better in comparison to the a7s iii too.  i love the file size of 4k 24p too at 100mbps vs. 150mbps with panasonic as well. this will save a lot of space on my computer. on top of this there are soo many cool lens options. 

but then there are all these frustrating things i have to deal with when using this camera. 
1. if you film with 2 sd cards recording simultaneously it overheats in about 40 min in a 70 degree room. even when the overheat setting is set to high. i had to switch to 1 card recording and lost my redundancy. at least it won't overheat now. i would be more than fine to see a little larger build so it would regulate heat better. 
2. you can't use an external monitor and the on camera monitor unless you turn off the settings display on the external monitor. this means you can't see record, mic output etc.  i had to get a cheap monitor with an hdmi out to get 2 screens to display the settings so i can change settings on the cam and also know what's happening when i film myself. 
3. in the saved settings i can't just go in and set the white balance. i have to go into m or p or a to set the white balance and save it. this is far from ideal. 

not being able to record simultaneously with 2 sd cards is almost a deal breaker for me but man the video quality and autofocus is sooooo good its hard to part with it.

category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment: excellent picture and sound. very pleased with this tv. i bought it to use in the bedroom. it replaced a samsung 40" tv that was six years old and went out.

name: sony - cyber-shot rx10 iv 20.1-megapixel digital camera - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Point & Shoot Cameras
review_comment:
superb camera.  i use this primarily as a work camera that requires fast operation and acquisition of my target and this camera has not let me down. 

outstanding optical and digital zoom capability and quality with ease of manipulation on this bridge camera. 

durable and good ergonomics in the design of this camera housing and functioning pieces. 

i've had great success taking pictures of people, animals, and landscapes. 

great quality in photos and 4k videos. 

i have not used the bluetooth functions yet, but a friend has told me that the bluetooth is great. 

amazing value for the pricepoint. 

robust menu functions allow for tailoring specific shots. good digital display that also tilts up and down only and has a little telescoping capability also.  no horizontal tilt with the display. 

my only two complaints have been with the date and time function and operating the camera in extreme heat situations.  it says that there is a date and time function, but this camera only does the date as a display on images. i have to use another program to at time when i need to for work. the camera works very well in all temps but becomes slightly glitchy when zooming in temps above 105°f (arizona temps). when the camera heats up inside these issues presented themselves.  on the adverse, when i keep the camera cool, even when in the hot environments, the camera has not issues and performs great.

i definitely recommend this camera.

name: nikon - z 5 4k video mirrorless camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment:
great mirrorless camera for beginners.
menu is easy to use and allows you to set custom buttons. i love that it has two memory card slot. decent battery life mist better than the canon eos rp.

my only complaint is the screen really only tilts up or down and does not swivel out.

review_comment: i transitioned from the sony a7 iii to this beautiful beast of a camera. i love the size and feel of the body a lot more than the sony’s. easy to use, great menu imo compared to sony. mirrorless is the way to go. i’m not a professional photographer but this camera makes things soooo simple to get the correct exposures. autofocus has caught up to sony. the 24-105 rf 4.0 glass is better than i thought it would be. i just love using this beauty. 45 mp is a beautiful thing.

name: sony - alpha 7 iv full-frame mirrorless interchangeable lens camera - (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: great upgrade at a great price
review_comment: great upgrade from the already great a7 iii.  i've had the a7 iii for a few years now and was looking to upgrade.  the a7 series of camera's has been good but the a7 iii made them a great buy at that price point.  the iv continues this with offering amazing features found in much more expensive cameras while keeping cost at a reasonable point.  if you are a studio photographer go for the r, if you shoot video go for the s, if sports are your thing or you want the best of the best, you can go with the a9 ii or a1.  but if you need a great all around performer that may not be the absolute best at anything but very good at everything, this is the one to get.

name: nikon - d850 dslr 4k video camera (body only) - black

review_title: i'm in love all over again
review_comment: upgrading from the nikon d810. changed all the settings to match with my old d810, and was in awe from the very first shoot i took. i'm in love all over again, wish i didn't take so long to get it, but was hoping a d880/d900 was on the way.

name: canon - eos rebel t7 dslr video two lens kit with ef-s 18-55mm and ef 75-300mm lenses - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body & Lens
review_title: good camera for beginners to intermediate users.
review_comment:
so far, i love this camera.  i'm not an advanced photographer so my review is one for the layman not the expert.  the camera feels like high quality, heavy but still manageable.  the shutter is fast, the lenses adjust well.

the only part that i've found to be a bit of a pain is taking pictures with the digital display screen.  it takes the camera quite a bit longer to focus and take the picture when using the lcd display as opposed to using the viewfinder.  when using the viewfinder, it is close to instant, when using the lcd screen, it seams to bog down and take longer.  that is enough to drop this camera down a star alone.

name: canon - eos r5 mirrorless camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: best camera i've ever owned.  game-changer!
review_comment:
this lens transformed my approach to photography, and i've been shooting professionally for 45 years. superb build quality, huge 45 mp file size, sharp and versatile lcd display, astonishingly good artificial intelligence-driven focusing, and an increasingly wide array of rf lenses designed just for canon's mirrorless camera bodies.  if you purchase this, be patient with yourself while you learn how to use it.  it's a whole new paradigm! 

note: this is a high-end camera.  many users (most, in fact) who aren't printing large exhibition prints will be just as happy with the r6, which has a much smaller image size (20 mp).  otherwise, the feature set is nearly identical to the r5, and you can take the money you save and invest it in lenses.

name: sony - zv-1 20.1-megapixel digital camera for content creators and vloggers - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Point & Shoot Cameras
review_title: needs a wider lens, bye bye elite status
review_comment:
the camera was very good but had a fatal flaw: the 24mm wife angle felt more like 27mm. this meant the camera image was just not wide enough to be held at arms length. 

i've returned the camera and will try the zv-10 with changeable lenses. however, i will not buy from best buy. i have been an elite rewards member for years but the program was killed days before my purchase. a late night 2am email "change in terms" was the only notification. poor service here for a decade long customer and when i returned the camera after 18 days i was shocked to be told that i could not return the camera. a manager took pity and gave a one time exception. 

i'll be buying from b&h or amazon in the future.

name: sony - cyber-shot rx100 vii 20.1-megapixel digital camera - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Point & Shoot Cameras
review_title: owned a rx100 v (sold it) and tried the zv-e10...
review_comment:
i like the vii it has a 3mm jack & articulating screen (unfolds up top).  the settings can be daunting and you need to really go thru the fn and menu (picture & video).  imho, got to go thru it at least twice to just get the basics.  

there are nuances that you (i) may just overlook.  i.e. got to figure out if i can close the viewfinder and keep camera on...it turns off if using viewfinder and then close.

i've been "dry firing"...pulling it up...turn on and knowing that i have it at the appropriate picture setting and video setting and pressing the appropriate buttons.  like a "point and shoot" knowing that i may have to go into fn or menu to set it properly.  

by the way, the mic works really well and the only problem is when you are in windy conditions.  i tested it by recording while in front of a fan...needs wind diffuser or use a lav mic.

this is a rather robust camera but i believe it's worth the price point but it does require your time and attention.

name: "sony - 48"" class bravia xr a90k oled 4k uhd smart google tv (2022)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_title: master level tv / monitor with accurate hdr
review_comment:
i relate my journey finding the best 48" oled to take over my computer: 
after having owned both the lg c1 and c2 48" i have to say this is hands down superior in nearly every category. i will proceed to list: 
1) hdr - after having tried several game titles and movies, the hdr on the c2/c1 look bloomy and often hide details. i was able to pick up on details i was never able to with the sony, it was kind of disappointing to see how much detail was being lost due to overblown hdr
2) though i can't confirm, this tv feels brighter than the c1 and c2, there's also better uniformity across the panel
3) pixel processing and upscaling is insanely superior on the sony, it reveals far more minute details of every scene
4) motion handling - this one the sony wins hands down. motion just feels superior, even when you enable the soap opera mode, it does it in a better way than the lg
5) os: it pains to say this but as much as i love webos, i really enjoy the way the menus are laid out on android tv. you don't need that fancy 'game mode' thing the lg has. the sony also has every setting and also far more accessible.
6) monitor specific: the sony has less aggressive abl out of the box meaning you will not get dark screens as aggressive while using the computer which can be frustrating at times. 

meanwhile, the only things i consider superior on the c2:
1) gsync: pc gaming does unquestionably feel more responsive on the c2, but the difference is not night and day. i can still fully enjoy my games despite not having the ultimate 'g-sync'
2) hdmi ports: not sure why sony couldn't make every port 2.1


sony just stepped up their game this year. this tv/monitor is superior to the c2. i don't think having 2 better categories can make up for all the other greatness that makes this tv the ultimate choice for your setup. go with the sony, i personally barely use g-sync and i bet a lot of us today don't.

name: "lg - 55"" class nanocell 75uqa series led 4k uhd smart webos tv (2022)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_title: excellent picture and color for a great price.
review_comment:
was looking for a great tv that would not be outdated within a year or two and wanted to stay in budget of $700 or under. researched and spoke to best buy agent and decided on going with nanocell. i wanted to go with lg or samsung. i have had both brands and they were great. movers broke my samsung curved and ended up selling my lg oled from 2017 as it was to big for the area i was moving to. 
so far this is great. picture is excellent and bright. i find the display much better than a high priced oled tv. i might stick with a nanocell for my living room but just up the screen size to a 65 inch. either way, i think i might stick to lg. i needed something with bright screen and colors for my mother who has retinopothy. she loves and it and can see everything very well. 

love that it has even apple tv built in. i don't need a separate device for it. can log in and watch all the movies i have purchased and they are in 4k. just had to hook up my nintendo switch. easy set up out of the box. tv is very light as well. 

the only issue is the response time with the remote to load another app seems to be delayed or freeze for a bit. it could be my wifi. hopefully maybe that will be fixed with a software update down the line. 

excellent quality tv for the price and the quality is just as good as oled. plus you don't risk burn in. 

very happy with my choice.

name: nikon - coolpix p950 16.0-megapixel digital camera - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Point & Shoot Cameras
review_title: love the versatility of this nikon p950 camera!
review_comment: i have owned dslr cameras and various lenses for many years. i loved the idea of a long zoom bridge camera, but was concerned about giving up image quality with the smaller sensor. however, i have been pleasantly surprised with what this camera is able to do with my favorite type photography of backyard birding. and just love the versatility of quickly moving from shooting an adult bluebird feeding its fledglings from a far distance to a closeup pic of an anole on the back porch.

name: canon - eos r7 mirrorless camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: great for sports or distance shooting!
review_comment: i purchased to replace my eos 7d mk2 soon after switching my 6d to a 6r. i'm very happy i changed. this cam seems perfect for shooting anything fast. that is, the camera's ability to capture so many pictures so quickly makes getting the shot even easier.

name: "sony - 42"" class bravia xr a90k oled 4k uhd smart google tv (2022)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_title: great tv, great geek squad install!
review_comment: i've been waiting for this tv for a long time and wasn't disappointed! the build quality is top-notch. the oled colors really sparkle. the sound is fine through my sonos sub and speakers. the backlit remote is a nice touch, and i can run my apple tv and cable box through the remote with no problem. also the geek squad guy who installed it was great, spending over two hours setting it up on a tabletop stand that i had (to fit the limited space) and really doing a superb job with cable management and tweaking the settings. i am one happy customer and look forward to watching college football on this tv - and the lotr 4k extended version!

name: "sony - 42"" class bravia xr a90k oled 4k uhd smart google tv (2022)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment:
wow, this tv is amazing. have a 65 s95b qd-oled as my main and this is for gaming primarily and it is amazing. going toe to toe with samsungs qd-oled, accuracy is on point and lag low enough to not notice compared to what lg offers. 

i used the sony a90j for reference in calibration/set up and i’m impressed. 

for gaming or a small space tv, nothing better when it comes to sonys processing and a great successor to the a90j. 

pictures don’t do it any kind of justice.

category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment:
this tv will ruin your vision of other manufacturers and their image processing.  i haven’t purchased a sony tv in over 7 years.  the last few have been lg and samsung.  seeing the set in action showed me what i have been missing.  the detail it brings to movies in dolby vision is unreal.  you have to see it to believe it.  i started watching shows and movies i have already watched, in amazement with the additional detail the tv brings.  it’s an entirely different experience!  but don’t just take my word for it, check the reviews and bring one home for yourself.  i guarantee, what ever other tv you have will be bowing down to this one. i use mine as a monitor and to play pc games….and wow……just wow……….

i just wished it came larger than 48”.  but sony played us.  to get that you’d have to purchase last years a90j or this years a95k (which i also purchased and love).

name: sony - alpha 1 full-frame mirrorless camera - body only - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment:
by far the best camera for a working photography and videographer. there are definitely are cheaper solutions out there if your doing one or the other and want to compromise on one side or the other but if you do both and want an edge over others with out having to have separate high end video and photo bodies. this gives you the best of both worlds in a small body with the ability to buy an battery housing to go for long periods of shooting or be as compact as possible when your on the go and want to be light. 8k video 50mp+ stills this camera can’t be beat for me personally already owning so many sony glass the it was an easy choice but for someone looking for a professional workhorse this camera deserves a good look over before you choose canon. i love canon and own older lenses but choose to move over with the a73 and this camera made that choice a rock solid one.

only complaint is for the price it could of had a flip screen but still five stars

name: canon - eos 90d dslr camera with ef-s 18-135mm lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body & Lens
review_comment: best camera ever! i'm starting in this photography world and i'm loving it. i did a lot of research to know which camera to buy and i don't regret buying this one! it's beautiful. i bought if for a trip and took photos of everything. 1 week and i didn't need to recharge the battery once.

save your money and buy something else because this camera was supposed to be the best but it’s not!

review_comment:
video quality and autofocus were pretty good for the small camera size. i ended up returning it because it was pretty bad in low light situations and overheated easily. i was filming behind the scenes content for a vlog and it overheated multiple times and refused to record anymore. 

the lens this package comes with also is not great. i would not recommend this lens.

pros: autofocus and video quality

cons: overheats easily

name: canon - eos r7 mirrorless camera with rf-s18-150mm f/3.5-6.3 is stm lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: this camera is a huge leap forward
review_comment: this camera is the subject of dozens of reviews on youtube and elsewhere. what’s missing is perspective on the amazing leaps in technology since dslrs were the only game in town. along comes canon’s first serious aps-c with a 30 mp sensor and the auto-focus tech of the r3, which costs $6k without a lens. for a fourth of the price, this camera offers a brilliant tool for any decent photographer to get heretofore unheard of shots of wildlife or high speed sports. it’s a game changer. i sold my 5d and a lens to buy it. the new rf kit lenses are unimpressive on their own, but the rest of the rf pro lens line is astoundingly good, which corresponds to the price tags.

name: canon - eos r5 mirrorless camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: should of made the switch years ago.
review_comment: i shot nikon for the last 12 years, my last camera being the d810.  i started shooting my kids sports teams.  the d810 held up okay but as the kids got older and faster i knew it was time to upgrade. the r5 has been amazing.  the autofocus, using the rf 70-200 2.8, is instant.  i'm getting shots i would of never had before on my old system.  i went with the r5 over the r6 because i use my camera for all types of photography, the r5 just does everything good.  i've really enjoyed the evf when it comes to reviewing photos.  there is a little lag but it doesn't prevent me from keeping up with fast moving subjects, just some getting use to.

review_comment: great camera for what is is geared towards. i have a z6 and needed a secondary camera while filming interviews. this camera performs really well and is easy to use. i paired it with a 40 mm f2 rather than the kit lens, and i couldn’t tell if there’s much of a difference in filming quality between this and the z6 when you’re filming straight in the cameras. without the viewfinder, i wouldn’t recommend this for stills.

name: "furrion - aurora 43"" full shade smart 4k uhd led outdoor tv (2022)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment:
second tv - first arrived destroyed. the only good for this tv is the quality is just ok. 2 stars.

bad:
- wireless is awful and can't reach beyond 20 feet - forget if there are walls. even with line of site at 20 feet the signal is weak. have to run an ethernet cable out of the house to the tv - lame

- bluetooth is worse and strange - guessing because the transmitter is somewhere in the back.
----- in front of the tv you can get maybe 5 feet and the bluetooth starts to get choppy and cuts out. when it does work - the audio is out of sync with the video most times and can't be adjusted
----- in back of the tv you can go 15 feet no problem? so what i can't see if from there.

- there is a fan of some sort inside the tv and is a little noisy - not enough to hear over the volume - but why is there a fan in there and will cold temps affect it? or is my unit defective again and i shouldn't be hearing this.

- webos / remote - terrible and clunky

name: nikon - z 30 4k mirrorless camera with nikkor z dx 16-50mm f/3.5-6.3 vr lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: charging of battery slow and prone to error
review_comment: purchased this camera because of positive reviews.  camera does not come with a charger, battery is charge installed in camera.  manual says it may take up to 7.5 hours to charge.  i charged for that long and charging light was still on.  i disconnected the charge and turned on camera and battery showed full,  so much for charging light being effective.    camera seems fine but if you buy it then plan on buying an external charge for the battery.  the charging process so frustrated me that i returned the camera and paid my 15% bestbuy restocking fee.

review_comment: overall, i’m satisfied with the purchase of this tv. it’s operating software is webos witch my other lg tvs have so i’m familiar with it. the picture is bright enough on sports games, animated cartoons, and a regular tv shows. the picture is not as good on movies with dark scenes (something like dark knight or game of thrones). not an issue for me as i bought this tv to watch sports games and entertain my kids. i’d rather watch darker scene movies indoors anyways. my tv is located under a covered patio.  it’s a smart tv,  has several apps and loading is fast on wifi. tv speakers are loud enough in my opinion.  the only negative has nothing to do with the tv.  the scheduling and delivery is through a 3rd party pilot freight services not best buy  and i found them to be unprofessional. i still received the time on tv on time and undamaged.
