name: nikon - z 30 4k mirrorless camera with nikkor z dx 16-50mm f/3.5-6.3 vr lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: nikon quality in compact form, with compromises
review_comment:
nikon's latest digital camera, the z 30, is their attempt at offering a creator-focused, video-forward device in what has quickly become a popular, competitive space: mirrorless cameras. to that end, nikon is aiming the z 30 squarely at the creator/vlogger/streamer crowd, with their marketing materials leaning heavily into the video capabilities and self photo/video capture abilities of their new camera. the z 30 also happens to be the most affordable entry point into nikon's z lineup of mirrorless cameras, meaning those of us that have been very curious about mirrorless devices but unwilling or unable to fork out thousands of dollars for a mirrorless camera have a new option to consider.

i'm approaching the z 30 as a amateur photographer and decade-long user of a nikon dslr who is new to the mirrorless field. i've loved my 2010-era nikon dslr for many years, and it's faithfully served me across the world. while my dslr is still fully functional and capable of high-quality images (a testament to the reliability of nikon products, for sure), it's sorely lacking many of the technological advances of the past decade.

the z 30 arrived in typical understated nikon packaging, with the 16-50mm kit lens, charging cable, camera strap and basic user manual and warranty documentation. upon first inspection it's clear that even with their entry-level model nikon goes great lengths to produce a quality product, with excellent fit-and-finish and a reassuring heft. yes, it's an all-plastic model, but don't let that be a turnoff. the z 30 and its kit lens are absolutely quality products, and plastic has the added benefit of being lightweight. 

if you've used any nikon dslr or mirrorless product you'll be right at home with the z 30. i've always been a fan of nikon's logical controls and excellent in-hand feel and the z 30 is no exception. despite being substantially smaller and lighter than my nikon dslr the z 30 feels every bit as comfortable in my hand, with the ergonomics i've come to expect from this brand. buttons may have moved around slightly but everything is instantly familiar and usable.

display tech has come a long way since my 2010 dslr, and the z 30's screen is excellent. it smartly swings out from the side and rotates 180 degrees, allowing you to position it exactly where you need to for the perfect shot, and then fold it away for safekeeping when you're done. resolution is great and touch sensitivity is top-notch -- if you've not had a touchscreen on your camera, it's a fantastic addition, giving you smartphone-like control when you need it but reassuringly backed up with a plethora of physical controls.

it's a good thing nikon includes a great screen, because you'll be using it 100 percent of the time. there's new viewfinder on the z 30, electronic or not, nor is there a built-in flash. those are two big differences between the z 30 and the z 50, the camera above this one in nikon's mirrorless system. there are pros and cons, and i think i still prefer a viewfinder in many cases (especially outside in direct sunlight), but having access to the touchscreen and full menus while framing your shot is awesome. my favorite feature is the tap-to-focus option, which lets you lock focus on your subject with a simple tap. importantly, the z 30 has enough screen resolution to see whether you hit the right focus target before you upload all your photos to your phone or computer.

connectivity is another strong suit of the z 30. this camera includes both bluetooth and wifi connection options and full compatibility with nikon's free snapbridge mobile app. connecting your phone or tablet to the z 30 with snapbridge is pretty straightforward, and i've had no connection problems since initial setup. communication is two-way and can be set to happen in the background, which enables awesome features like gps location on your photos and videos and automatic uploading of your photos to your mobile device for immediate sharing. i encourage you to explore all the settings in snapbridge and the camera menus, as leaving all the options turned on the background drains your camera and mobile device batteries faster, and uploading every photo can quickly become annoying. snapbridge also enables remote control of the z 30, which depending on your use case can be invaluable. i definitely appreciated the ability to connect to the z 30 via wifi and selectively upload full-resolution jpegs to my phone on a recent business trip where i found myself without an sd card reader. 

the z 30 includes menus upon menus of controls for fine-tuning your photos, videos and camera behaviors, accessible from the camera's display using both touch and physical controls. if you're familiar with nikon's menu structures you'll once again find yourself right at home, but if you're intimidated by the sheer volume of options, you'll be happy to know the camera can handle everything with alacrity in its automatic mode. even after a decade of nikon use i still appreciate the "?" option available on many camera menus, which offers a succinct description of many controls to guide you as you use the camera. it's quicker than a web search and can save you from mucking things up when you're out using your z 30.

so how does this nikon perform? with photos, my comfort area, i'd say the z 30 is top-notch. the 20 megapixel crop sensor (dx apc-c size, aka 1.5 times smaller than a full-size sensor) provides more than enough detail, and nikon's fabulous image processing, auto-focusing and color-handling prowess is on full display here. photos are generally sharp and balanced, colors are accurate and focus is on-point, every bit as good and better than my dslr. nikon's excellent 16-50mm kit lens really is a gem, with a very usable focal range and great image stabilization. if you know nikon's dx cameras you know they don't come with image stabilization in the camera body, instead relying on the lens, denoted by the "vr" branding in this lens' full name. image stabilization is high on my priority list for someone that snaps photos almost exclusively handheld. this kit lens produces great results at all focal lengths with appropriate lighting, and nikon's excellent iso capabilities mean you can get good results in low light, although you'll want to stay close to that 16mm length for the best results. the z 30 produces quality images even at high isos, but you'll certainly start to notice digital noise as the iso increases. regardless, this lens focuses quickly and silently, introduces almost no distortion, can produce great background blur and folds up into itself for storage and transport. the z 30 with this lens is a compact, lightweight shooter, perfect for popping in your bag and infinitely more transportable than even the smallest dslrs. 

video quality is great, especially with the built-in stereo mics, photo-and-video "selfie" mode (rotate the screen to face the same direction as the lens, turn the camera around and you'll have a selfie powerhouse), and i'm sure video types will appreciate the ability of the z 30 to record continuously for 125 minutes, much longer than many competitors. 

however, there are a few things keeping the z 30 from a perfect score in my mind. advertised as a video-forward device, the z 30 lacks a few important options. while it can record beautiful 4k video, it can only do so at 30 frames per second. the going rate these days is 60 fps, which the z 30 can only do in 1080p. the difference between 30 and 60 fps is noticeable even to untrained eyes. with 4k video quickly becoming the standard i think nikon's decision to limit the z 30 to 30 fps in 4k resolution is problematic, especially considering modern smart phones can shoot 4k in 60 or even 120 fps. add to this the z 30's lack of a headphone jack -- which means you can't listen to your audio through stereo headphones as it's recorded, leaving you guessing as to the real audio quality until you upload your video to your editing device -- and i'm left scratching my head as to why nikon left out two key video features you can find in the mobile device you're probably reading this review on. 

for me personally, the bigger issue is the lack of dx-specific lenses for nikon's dx-line mirrorless cameras like the z 30 and z 50. nikon has dozens of z-mount lenses, yes, but only three dx-specific z-mount lenses. the 16-50mm kit lens is very good, but the lack of options is noticeable even to this amateur hobbyist photographer. dx-line nikons lack in-body image stabilization, meaning a lens without nikon's vr designation leaves you with no image stabilization whatsoever, a huge loss when shooting handheld, especially in low-light situations. hands-down my best low-light photos come from so-called "fast prime" lenses that offer fixed focal lengths and ultra-low minimum apertures. nikon has no dx-line fast prime z lenses, instead offering only fast-primes without vr, designed mainly for use on their full-frame models. while you can use these lenses on the z 30, you'll be doing so without image stabilization, possibly resulting in blurry photos when shooting handheld on the ultra-compact, lightweight z 30.

overall, i really, really like the nikon z 30. it's delightfully compact but reassuringly high-quality, it's easy for anyone to use, and it can produce excellent images. that said, i think nikon missed the mark when it comes to video, with no 60 fps at 4k resolution and no headphone jack to be found. as a photographer i can forgive these omissions, but i am pretty disappointed in the lack of affordable, dx-focused lenses, especially the infinitely-useful fast-prime type. i am waiting anxiously for nikon to reveal their planned "24mm dx" z-mount prime, which -- if it includes vr and a reasonable price tag -- will be a must-have for me and many others.

name: nikon - z 30 4k mirrorless camera with nikkor z dx 16-50mm f/3.5-6.3 vr lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: need a camera for both video and photo? buy this!
review_comment:
i’ve been a content creator now for around 10 years, having used various cameras to shoot b-roll video for various youtube creators, and for my own personal photography projects. my main camera for a few years was a nikon dslr which i’d purchased at best buy as part of a bundle kit. it worked well for standard photography projects, but lacked the detail or stabilization for video shoots. so, when i had the opportunity to test drive the new nikon z30, i jumped at the chance to take this to a local pumpkin festival to capture shots with my visiting family.

this particular nikon came with a creator bundle, including the camera body, a 16-50mm lens, a rode microphone, an attachable handle which can hold the included remote and act as a small tripod, the owners manual, a battery, and a usb charging cable. you will need an sd card, and in my case chose to purchase a larger capacity sandisk at best buy that happened to be on sale. you will need to attach the lens to the body, install the battery, and allow the nikon to charge.

one of the first things you’ll notice about this camera is the lack of a viewfinder. since this is marketed for content creators, you’ll have a touchscreen lcd display which can be positioned for selfie shots, or swiveled and tucked back in to allow you to view and take photos on the fly. the menu navigation allows for use of the touchscreen, or you can use the directional pad and ok button on the camera to make selections. while this is marketed as a 4k camera, you’ll find various frame sizes and frame rate options; with options for 1080p at up to 120 frames per second. it even includes three slow motion options for 1080 video! this isn’t something i can say another other camera i own has. given the lighter weight of the camera, you can opt to use the handle with the remote to start and stop video recording without needing to touch the camera directly. i also found that the video taken was stabilized well without a lot of video distortion. while this won’t likely match an action camera, it’s pretty great for capturing video of events knowing your video won’t look shaky.

if you’re using this for general photography, you’ll find this nikon very capable of handling your photo needs. i tend to stay with raw+fine jpeg, but if you’re using a smaller capacity sd card, you can adjust this for just jpeg (fine, normal, and basic) or just raw. the auto-focus using the included 16-50mm lens is quick, and when capturing moments on the fly makes for great photos with minimal waiting for the lens to focus. you can even set your preference for the “vignette” or turn it off entirely if you want to avoid the blurring along the edge of your shots. you can also set the image size between small (2784x1856), medium (4176x2784), and large (default - 5568x3712). the larger the image, the larger the file size, with the settings showing a large image storing about 20 mb per shot. while this isn’t marketed as a still photography model, you’ll find the nikon z 30 able to handle all of your photo/video needs.

given the cost of this camera, the ability to swap out the lens for other sizes, a quick auto-focus, and one of the best 4k video cameras i’ve used this an easy recommendation. the versatility of this camera makes it a great choice for those looking to jump in to content creation or those needing a camera that can handle both video and photography tasks. it also allows you to use this on your pc as a webcam when connected over usb. it was detected by my windows pc quickly, and was immediately able to use. i also didn’t experience any overheating with over an hour worth of use outdoors; compared to my larger mirrorless camera. i honestly feel nikon really delivered with this camera, and it has become the camera i take with me to every video shoot.

category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment: i'm new to photography, this camera was super easy to learn and it so fun to play with. touch screen makes it easy to scroll through options, picture is amazing!

name: sony - alpha a6400 mirrorless camera with e pz 16-50mm f/3.5-5.6 oss lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment:
i am not a professional. i’ve always loved taking pictures, but decided to invest into my first camera. i was told by many photographer friends that they always end up falling in love with sony, so i decided to give it a try and i’ve loved it. i’m still learning. but it’s so easy and user friendly! shooting in automatic is pretty simple and straight forward, but i’ve loved learning manual mode. if you’re a beginner, i would recommend this camera-as long as you are good with technology. don’t get me wrong, as great and fun as this experience has been, it takes trial and error and time to understand features and work around them. so don’t expect to just suddenly be a great photographer. 

my final review, 9/10, even 10/10! it’s a 10/10 when you purchase lenses for it (besides the kit it comes with).

(the picture attached is a quick shot i took of my dog when first opening the package. just to show the quality of the photos at first shot)

name: sony - alpha 7 iv full-frame mirrorless interchangeable lens camera - (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment: sony has done it again with the a7iv mirrorless camera!

name: fujifilm - x-t5 mirrorless camera with xf16-80mmf4 r ois wr lens bundle - silver
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: great camera with old school feel
review_comment: ive had my xt5 since release day, i shot film for decades, ran mt own dark room etc, but for the life of me could not make myself enjoy digital photography, i always felt it was kind of souless fot lack of a better word, i tried multiple dslr’s then just kind of gave it up. i recently decided to get back into it and bought a nikon z5 its nice but didnt grab me, still have it and it takes nice pictures but i saw the xt5 and have it a shot despite all the hype around full frame, im 100% in love with this thing, it looks and feels like a real camera, the images it produces are simply amazing imo, low light performance is fantastic with a fast lens, so much so that i shot the milkyway on both my nikon(with a nikon z prime) and my xt5 (with a cheap rokinon lens) and the pictures from the xt5 are the ones everyone i show prefers. i dont shoot video at all so i cant comment on that. the abilty to crop so heavily from the 40mp sensor is a great bonus, autofocus is fast and accurate, the controls feel completely manual but still have the abilty to customize things well and use button shortcuts etc, its like the perfect mix if old shcool and newer tech convenience. this camera might not be for everyone but if you appreciatethe design aesthetic and like shooting manual there is nothing out there imo that feels as nice.

category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment: sony is great for its price. tons of lens option. autofocus is superb

name: "sony - 42"" class bravia xr a90k oled 4k uhd smart google tv (2022)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment:
we really wanted a bigger one, even the 48", but have an enclosure that doesn't permit it. 
we loved our old (10 yrs) 40" xbr, and this is better - not as bright as the old one, but no parallax (you can watch somewhat from the side with no reduction in visual quality), and great color saturation. i like sony because of the natural quality of the colors and skin tones, and this oled technology is great - although better in the bigger ones. this 42" is smaller exterior dimension than our old 40" because it is all screen edge to edge, no bezel. i like it.

name: nikon - d850 dslr 4k video camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body Only
review_title: great camera, bit of a learning curve
review_comment: i’ve slowly but steadily climbed the ladder of nikon dslrs, now arriving at the d850. the d850 is a significant upgrade from the d5600 or d7500. and while i considered myself to be close to an expert at using those cheaper cameras, i’ve struggled in the first few weeks with the d850. take some time to practice with the settings, particularly autofocus, and it will make a world of difference. in other words, be patient. right out of the box, you’ll need to fine tune it to your liking. but once you get it squared away, you will love it.

review_comment:
i previously owned a canon rebel t3 and liked it a lot. my kids now own the t3 and it was time to get a new camera. the t7 was in my price range and had a ton of updates since the t3 model so i snatched it up on a black friday sale.
i was not disappointed, the update to 24mp and the addition of wifi and bluetooth were a big plus.
it is a great beginner camera and if it were not such a big jump from a beginner to intermediate camera  (between $400 and $600) i might have gone mirror less. but for the occasional wildlife shots this is all i really need.

name: nikon - z 30 4k mirrorless camera with nikkor z dx 16-50mm f/3.5-6.3 vr lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment:
amazing camera at this price point! 4k 30fps, single-clip, long-form recording when you're filming events (not multiple 5-minute clips like my old nikon d7500). crystal clear, and the internal microphone is actually pretty darn good (although i typically connect an external mic).

this camera is truly intended for vloggers and self-shooting, but it serves me well as a b-camera for videos and even photos. z-mount kit lenses are pretty good, too. although, i typically connect my f-mount sigma lenses to this bad boy with my nikon ftz adapter. sigma will be releasing z-mount lenses in 2023, so i'm excited about that.

another great callout, you can film in slow motion and time lapse with this camera, too. i recently filmed and snapped photos at a conference in philly, and my z-30 outperformed my old d7500. it's not a sony alpha for sure, but to be intended for vloggers, this little mirrorless companion can do more than advertised. if you're looking for a better-than-average camera to record yourself for youtube/social media/your website or use at family gatherings, this is a great purchase for sure.

name: "lg - 27"" class led full hd smart webos tv with countertop design (2022)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment: i was on the lookout for a countertop tv and this one fits my requirements just perfectly. the white color adds to the overall look of the tv and gives a good facelift to my kitchen. although it is great for movies and playing games, i am using it more often to listen to music while working in the kitchen. the picture quality is crisp and clear, much sharper than an hd tv. not to mention its compact size and design which lets it fits nicely in one corner of the countertop. it doesn’t look out of size on the countertop and gives a nice viewing experience while cooking or cleaning the kitchen. since this is led,it has superior brightness, and high color contrast to make the picture quality amazing. although it faces slightly diagonally to my gas stove but the best viewing angle is from the center. the backlight type is direct lit so it can be used in any room with different room brightness and gives a good light uniformity. i love to enjoy the streaming apps straight from the tv like netflix, disney+, prime video, hulu, youtube. overall a great quality tv. i am happy with the performance and ease of using this tv.

name: canon - eos rp mirrorless 4k video camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment: i had an early digital camera in the late 90’s and another in the mid 2000’s that was okay but never really stepped up to the current era of cameras. i did use a canon 70d at work for many years so i was comfortable with the canon architecture and decided on canon when it came time for finally buying my own. i also wanted a full frame, mirrorless camera and i narrowed it down to the rp & r. i really did not see the advantages of the price difference so opted for the rp. so far i have purchased a couple lenses, extension grip and a spare battery for the unit and have overall been satisfied in its performance. i will need to secure an external flash since there isn’t one built in (although from what i gather none of the r series cameras have an internal flash) but aside from that i’m very happy with it. i’ve heard some folks criticizing the crop on the 4k recording, but video is not my primary focus with this camera. i’ve also heard reports of some earlier models of the rp overheating in hot or humid conditions, but since this unit has been around about 4 years hopefully those issues have been resolved at the factory. no problems on my end yet, however it hasn’t experienced a deep south humid summer yet. i’m highly satisfied so far with the limited time i’ve had with it. i’ve included a photo i took of my fish tank.

name: panasonic - lumix s5ii mirrorless full frame camera with 20-60mm f3.5-5.6 l mount lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment: i’ve owned this camera for a little under two weeks now, and i can safely say that this is hands down.. the best / most technologically advanced camera i have ever owned. my first dslr was a nikon d40, and my last camera was a fuji x-t2. which i still own. anyway, this is my first full frame camera. i’ve always wanted one and i finally made the leap. i’m glad i waited this long for one. this camera remains pretty small, considering. the included kit lens is decent for most day to day photography and videos. the kit lens struggles ever so slightly in low light, but it is still pretty reliable. the autofocus on this camera is pretty amazing. it accurately tracks my nephews while they’re running around. i went ahead and got the panasonic 50mm f1.8 lens also and i would recommend it if you want a nice fast prime lens to pair it with also.  you can record video apsc mode or full frame mode in everything from 1080p 60 fps up to 6k 30 fps. i shoot in 4k / 30fps and the video quality is crisp! neither of the lenses that i own for this camera have ois, but the built in ibis of the camera is great for handheld photos and videos. i love it. i never used any of my older cameras for video because they were always so shaky and the autofocus was never reliable. the autofocus on the  lumix s5ii is very reliable. i also love the colors straight out of the camera. after two weeks of use, i am still finding new things in the settings menu. it’s pretty wild. battery life is decent, it charges via usb c, so you can give it a quick littl top off with a standard usb c cable or battery pack when you’re not using it. i thought it was a little heavy initially but i’ve become accustomed to its size and weight and honestly i don’t have many complaints or any regrets on spending my money on this camera kit. i am confident that i will be able to take tons of great photos and videos with this kit for many years to come. i forgot to mention that this camera will literately record video until either your battery dies or you run out of memory i’m your sd card. it’s awesome. no overheating, no recording limits. my only complaint about this camera is that once in a while it takes a couple seconds longer to power on. not sure why, maybe it goes into a deep sleep / power off when your turn it off and leave it off for a long time. all in all, i highly recommend this camera to anyone who wants a professional grade camera for videos and photos. i am fully invested into the fujifilm camera system and i have no regrets buying this camera kit. i’m not going to sell off all my other stuff, but i think this will be my main camera going forward.

name: sony - alpha 7r v full-frame mirrorless camera with interchangeable lens (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: the best until the next model tomorrow, wait not!
review_comment: a very complex camera with functions for all photographers but only a few will use all! i have used sony cameras since '14 with the a7s where using adapters i used old film lenses even captured a lunar eclipse with a canon fd telephoto lens and feel in love with astro milky ways and in '17 the a7rii with ibis were i captured antelope canyon handheld while bracketing 3 @ +/- 2 ev using the new fe 12-24mm f/4 while other had to use sticks and most at only 35mm. and the cameras have apps on camera that make them just a valuable as the day they came out! the a7rv you need the 900 page book to know all or most all functions, a lot to keep in your head while out and about. it's noise control at high iso's is equal to the a7sm3 as well as its video powers if not better. i still have all my old sony's and an almost complete collection of lenses and still use film lenses at times. i am not a gear hog but want the abilities i see today to capture. bottom line the everyday camera for anything but start with a a7rm2 to get your feet wet you may never go higher it is also that great. all other makers have been behind the 8 ball and have not caught up yet. sony sensors are in most all cell phones as well as processors that should mean something.

name: "roku - 55"" class plus series qled 4k smart rokutv"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment:
i purchased the 55” roku plus series qled tv for $500. overall, this is a great tv for streaming 4k content. the image quality is what i expected for mid-range tvs at this price and i feel confident in my purchase. 

pros:

built-in roku os. this is the most obvious reason for purchasing the tv, but it is quite important. roku os is the best smart tv platform in my opinion as it doesn’t shove ads in my face like firetv or chromecast, and roku won’t just drop support for it after 3-4 years like other built-in smart tv os (looking at you, samsung). the user interface is responsive and very simplistic, setup is easy and anyone can find the apps they’re looking for without issue. the voice remote can also find any content you’re looking for with a single button press.

as this tv was designed by roku itself, an american company, i don’t have any privacy concerns that i may have from buying comparable tvs from chinese companies like hisense or tcl.

the tv gets pretty bright. i have no issues seeing the image clearly in well-lit rooms. this means the tv looks great in hdr with support for dolby vision. the qled panel layer also makes the tv quite colorful and vibrant in marvel’s sci-fi movies and games like mario kart. 


cons: 

not the best tv for gaming. no 120 hz or vrr support for newer ps5 or xbox series x consoles (to be fair, those features are hard to find at this price point). new consoles do not look bad on this tv, but there may be better alternatives depending on your budget. nintendo switch and older consoles still look fine as they do not utilize these features. however, gaming mode must be turned on for acceptable input latency, at a slight loss of image quality. 

there is a very noticeable blooming around bright white-on-black objects such as subtitles. this can be reduced by turning down the full array local dimming setting, but results in an overall loss of contrast as the black colors turn more gray.

the stand feels very cheap and unstable. i felt as if i stripped both the screws and my screwdriver trying to attach the two legs of this tv. the tv is fairly stable under its own weight but i would definitely prefer if the legs had less wiggle room.

some settings are very hard to find. i’ve read this tv supports motion smoothing and fine-tune color calibration, but i can’t find the settings anywhere. roku’s website states some settings can only be adjusted in their smartphone app, but i can’t find the settings in the app either because roku’s own guide asks me to click a ‘more’ button that isn’t there. i would appreciate if roku could patch a software update that allows me to adjust all advanced tv settings from the tv itself.

name: "roku - 55"" class plus series qled 4k smart rokutv"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_title: easy to use and great picture
review_comment: the roku platform is so quick and responsive, and makes it easy to select inputs and choose tons of free content.  to my eye, the picture is fantastic, with plenty of contrast and detail in both bright and dark scenes.  the auto brightness feature works great, and the sound is excellent - no more missed dialogue.  couldn’t be happier with this purchase.

name: "lg - 65"" class nanocell 75uqa series led 4k uhd smart webos tv (2022)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_title: my 1st and last lg tv purchase
review_comment: if you have low expectations you may really enjoy this television.  however the flaws at this pricepoint are pretty bad. the remote is not user friendly at all. pressing buttons comes with significant lag. this includes changing inputs or adjustjng the volume. the apps and menu navigation is extremely laggy as well. the tv disconnects from the wifi quit often. the fix consists of unplugging the tv for about 60 seconds to power cycle and then turn back on and reconnect. this happens at least a couple of times per week. finally my assessment of the picture quality is that its only mid. not great, not bad, just somewhere in the middle. the problem with this is that there are lower priced tvs with much much better picture quality and faster response times using the system. i purchased this tv and a cheaper samsung tv on the exact same day. the lg went in my living room while the samsung went to my bedroom. after nearly 1 year of use i am confident in saying the samsung tv is vastly superior.  it out performs this lg in every single way. in addition to that, it was cheaper. i will not be buying another lg tv probably ever.

name: "sony - 48"" class bravia xr a90k oled 4k uhd smart google tv (2022)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs

review_comment: amazing camera so far only had it for about three weeks or so but i can say that the picture quality is amazing as a beginning photographer try and understand full frame cameras. this has been the perfect camera to start with . amazing video, the auto focus is very, very nice. next time when i buy a camera i’m definitely going to buy it from best buy again because the customer service was amazing and also help me understand what camera is right for me and this is the perfect beginners camera. i bought a few lenses with it already got a bunch of accessories . i would highly recommend this camera.

name: panasonic - lumix s5ii mirrorless full frame camera with 20-60mm f3.5-5.6 l mount lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment: i am not an expert camera user, but i was tired of buying cameras which results in blurred images more often. so i decided to spend more on a proper camera this time. and this camera amazes me. taking pictures even while moving fast, i am getting clear pictures and videos. even thought i get some bad pictures very rarely in dark ambience, but i think it might be due to my limited knowledge of various options available in the camera settings menus/buttons. don't hesitate to buy this camera. no integrated flash, but why do you need it ?

review_title: i put it side by side from a c2
review_comment: the sony did some definition more sharp but over all it felt like not a great experience as a monitor compared to rhe c2. i didnt like how to get hdr to work and 120hz to work and tinkering that way. i never felt i was getting the best picture. with the c2. it was just plug in. spot check and fine. i only use it as a monitor though.

name: sony - zv-1f vlog camera for content creators and vloggers - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Point & Shoot Cameras
review_comment:
zv-1f is a newer release and has a usb-c
the old zv-1 model still has micro-usb

the dimensions are the not same.

zv-1f has a full touch menu
zv1 only had a touch focus (not for navigating menu).

this is marketed as "for vloggers". it's an entry level more than a pro level, like the rx100 (for more heavy pro users), with its limitations. 

if you just want a simple "vlogging" camera where you hit record and some light manual adjustments, this camera is for you. 

battery is np-bx1 (same with most sony compact cameras)

i've been a canon photographer, but i think sony is more advanced and innovative with their camera and features. 

the "product showcase set" feature is really cool and works well; if you do product videos, it can rack focus back and forth smoothly of you and the object in front, like holding a pencil.

review_comment: sony shooter for a long time and recently switched over to lumix. this 1000% replaced my sony a74 for video work. the video features packed into this camera for the price is realllllly hard to beat. the vlog color profile + ability to shoot prores raw has been the easiest color grading i've ever encountered. i'm not a colorist by any means and this platform made it easy to get work done. the pictures are also very nice and on par with sony/canon in a similar price range. overall this is my go to video camera for client work before i reach for my sony.

name: "roku - 65"" class plus series qled 4k smart rokutv"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment:
i bought this tv to replace an insignia roku tv that had the backlight go out. that was a great tv and always worked as expected. i erroneously assumed that a tv actually made by roku would be even better...you know what they say about assuming...
i have had nothing but trouble with this tv. settings randomly change, channel randomly changes, it turns itself off mid program, the glitches go on and on. "some" of the bugs appear to have been corrected with the latest update, but we'll see. as for the highly touted (by roku) voice remote that came with the tv, it is junk. after 2 months of use, it refuses to stay paired with the tv. if i want to use it, i have to re-paired it multiple times daily. customer 'support' has been useless - they even told me to contact lg!! what the?? after i told them for the umpteenth time that it is a roku tv allegedly made by roku, they (via twitter messaging) told me to contact roku! i was already chatting with roku support. i went on another site to just buy a new remote today, and read the reviews for the voice remote pro, apparently i am not the only person to have the remote refuse to stay paired after a short amount of use. i would think this is a known problem, they would actually make right, obviously they won't.
roku use to have excellent customer support and products, i have touted their products for years. i can no longer do that. 
i can not recommend their products anymore.

review_title: my view on this furrion tv
review_comment:
so, we wanted an outdoor tv, we did alot of looking around, this tv did not have much of a review on best buy or anywhere in fact. that concern me a little but wasn’t a deal breaker. after getting it out the box which is seamless. we plug it in , no picture no nothing. so not good. we went into got to get this tv back to best buy. but wait after researching again this furrion took and hour to warm up. what” believe me it was worth the wait. beautiful tv picture, setting up simple enough. it adjusts its self to those sunny morning and sunny evening. beautiful seamless picture at night. my family loves this tv. if it wasn’t for the wait and having to do (extra research) this tv is worth 5 stars. 

p.s this tv does not come with a stand. no wall unit system.

review_comment: i’m thrilled with my new r8.  i upgraded from the m50… big jump there.  i wanted full frame and was considering the rp but for not that much more to get so much more camera.  images are great and feels great in my hands.  i’m using older canon fd lenses and also ef-l series lenses, both with adapters.  both are widely available uses for great prices on ebay and work great with an adapter.  5 stars for sure

name: canon - eos rebel t7 dslr video camera with 18-55mm lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body & Lens
review_title: capture life’s moments with the canon eos rebel t7
review_comment: i recently purchased the canon eos rebel t7 dslr video camera with 18-55mm lens - black and i am extremely happy with my purchase. the camera is easy to use and takes high-quality photos and videos. the built-in wi-fi feature makes it easy to share photos and videos with friends and family. the camera also has a 24.1 mp cmos sensor and digic 4+ image processor which allows for high-quality images and full hd videos. the camera is lightweight and compact, making it easy to carry around. the 18-55mm lens is perfect for capturing a variety of shots, from wide-angle landscapes to portraits. overall, i would highly recommend this camera to anyone looking for a high-quality camera that is easy to use and produces great results.

name: panasonic - lumix s5iix mirrorless full frame camera with 20-60mm f3.5-5.6 l mount lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment: i have always been a fan of panasonic lumix cameras. maybe its because i like the underdog. well the lumix s5iix is far from being an underdog and seeing how the lumix s5ii has performed since its release is what really attracted me to this camera. with all the improvements made to the a-focus and the best image stabilization around.i am mainly going to use this camera for video, but i like having the capability to do photography  i couldn't be happier

name: "sony - 48"" class bravia xr a90k oled 4k uhd smart google tv (2022)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment:
got this as open box so price was great. disappointed it came with missing terminal covers and mounting plate.   as quoted by best buy as open box- excellent condition .  was able to find parts on ebay luckily- so all said still a great price and panel was 99 % perfect.

wanted this tv really to compare to the four lg oled's i own: b6-65, c8-55, cx-48 and finally c2-42 which again i love.

so far it's hard to complain -all a great tv's.  lg wins for panel sleekness and operating system.  sony maybe edges on slight pop and processing.  in any case she's apart of the family now and looking forward to watching more content.  

future tv at this point oled 77 g3 but waiting for 65 to run its course 6 years in and counting.   she did get a new panel for burn in which lg did not want to replace when tech came over.  funny thing was the guy who made the decision was on facetime with tech and said he couldn't see the problem go figure. terrible common sense decision in which you would think actual tech would decide total scam.  eventually got unwatchable and the best buy warranty covered it with complete agreement.
hence always good to get the extra best buy warranty as they have always been great for me.

name: "sony - 42"" class bravia xr a90k oled 4k uhd smart google tv (2022)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs

name: "tcl - 32"" class s3 s-class led full hd smart tv with google tv (2023)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_title: good tv and decent image quality.
review_comment:
this is a decent tv for the money. yes, you can find cheaper models, but the image quality is a bit better. colors look vibrant and i was surprised that the television has a decent contrast ratio. there is some banding that is more noticeable at an angle, but when looking directly at the tv it almost disappears. this is much more of an issue with its viewing angle. there is some dirty screen affect that is not noticeable with content on.

the tv boots/turns on quickly and all streaming services work great. i am putting this into my camper and the tv will work great as it has a low power draw too. my only complaint is the audio is not good, but you can't expect much from such a flat and smaller television. 

i am happy with the tv and give it four stars as i am comparing it against the oled tv's i have, but it is an unfair comparison lol. 

so it deserved four stars as its not perfect...but good.

name: sony - alpha a6400 mirrorless camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment:
the sony a6400 is a powerful and versatile mirrorless camera that delivers exceptional performance in a compact form factor. as an avid photographer, i had the opportunity to use the a6400 extensively, and i must say it left a lasting impression.

one of the standout features of the a6400 is its autofocus system. with 425 phase-detection autofocus points and 0.02-second acquisition speed, this camera locks onto subjects with remarkable precision and speed. whether you're capturing fast-moving action or shooting portraits, the autofocus performance is truly impressive.

the a6400 boasts a 24.2-megapixel aps-c sensor, which delivers stunning image quality with excellent detail and accurate colors. the camera's low-light capabilities are also commendable, thanks to its iso range of 100-32000 (expandable to 102400). it performs admirably in challenging lighting conditions, minimizing noise while retaining impressive clarity.

name: sony - alpha a6400 mirrorless camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: my sony a6400 purchase was highly successful
review_comment: has been an amazing camera. does everything i need it to do and more ! thank you so much :)

name: canon - eos rebel t7 dslr video two lens kit with ef-s 18-55mm and ef 75-300mm lenses - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body & Lens
review_comment: i bought this camera lens kit because i am just starting up doing photography. it's so nice not using my phone anymore! havent owned a camera for years. it is very easy to use, i love how easy the manual settings are to access. i've already used it so much and captured so many amazing photos already. i would definitely recommend getting this if you are just jumping back into photography or jusy starting out! one of my favorite features is the ability to transfer pictures straight from the camera to my cellphone/tablet using the wifi capabilities. makes it so easy if you're on the go and dont have quick access to a laptop or computer right away. you can also use your phone to shoot remotely as well which is super helpful. i would definitely buy this product again and recommend to everyone.

name: "roku - 65"" class plus series qled 4k smart rokutv"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment:
roku tvs have always been a favorite of mine for their easy to use and convenient interface, and the picture quality has always been really good for the price.
this tv is no exception to that, and actually brings those benefits even further. 
roku os is fast, easy to use, and packed with features i couldn't even find on samsung. 
the picture quality is simply amazing, especially for the price you can pick this tv up at. it looks almost like an oled display, it's so good. i see no tv backlight on dark scenes, either.
the tv remote is comfortable to hold and has a number of nice features to it.
i have not yet got to test the built in speakers, but i have no doubt they're great since even the cheaper roku tvs i've owned have had great speakers quality.

for this tv being roku's first tv release on their own brand, they did really, really good here. definitely do not regret switching to this from a more expensive samsung qled. i'll definitely be picking up roku's oled tv whenever it releases.

review_comment: i bought this for my wife. the camera works perfectly. she started to use it right away. she told me that she loves the camera. it was a very good purchase.

name: panasonic - lumix s5ii mirrorless full frame camera with 20-60mm f3.5-5.6 l mount lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: s5 ii long term review along with the 2.0 update
review_comment:
i bought this at best buy at the time it came out and then also bought a 16-35mm lens from b&h as well. having the 20-60mm is nice to have a back up semi-wide angle lens that also gives me a little more reach. 

camera's i owned or extensively tested:
sony dsc-rx10 ii
panasonic gh4
panasonic gh5
panasonic s5 
sony a7 iv with 16-35 f2.8
sony a7s iii with 16-35 f2.8
panasonic gh6
& now the panasonic s5ii

i use this for video for work but also want to shoot some good photo's here and there for work and for pleasure. 

let me just say this panasonic s5ii is the best camera i've ever owned for these reasons. 

1. autofocus- on par with the sony a7 iv i owned briefly but had to sell due to overheating. the older panasonic models just couldn't keep up. i really wanted to love the gh6 and it's an amazing camera but the autofocus was the deal breaker. i miss some aspects of the gh6 like 4k 60pfs and 120fps with no crop but that is about it. 

2. no overheating ever! this fan is soo cool. i often shoot 6k open gate/3:2 for 3-4 hrs at a time. i shoot a 20-30 minute vid, take a break for a few min and shoot another 20-30 min vid over and over for 3-4hrs. the sony a7 iv could only shoot the first one and then it would overheat on the second. instead of taking 3-4 hrs to shoot my vids it would take 5-6 trying to cool down the sony. even worse is it shuts down mid sentence so it really throws you off your game when you turn it back on. 

3. 180 degree shutter! this is so key. i never screw up a shot because the shutter angle is always perfect. 

4. picture quality- i could never easily grade my sony but it is soo easy to color grade the s5ii. especially after the 2.0 firmware update. the image quality is exceptional based on what i'm used to and after the 2.0 update the real time lut with vlog requires very little editing in post. shooting in 3:2 6k open gate gives me soo much room to zoom in as well as shoot for social media. i could do that pretty well with the gh6 but not with this much image quality. 

5. this is a great picture camera. maybe not as good as my old a7iv but it's really great for being such a video beast. there are soo many cool features like the 96mp stills feature, astrophotography feature and many others that just make this more camera than most at this price point. 

6. sound quality is amazing. panasonic just does better sound than anyone else at this price point. it just sounds soo good with external mics vs. sony. its a pain to reduce the 4 channels of audio to 1 like most clips in premiere pro but it's worth it to have this kind of audio. 

7. camera build is top notch. panasonic makes a camera the just feels durable. most other cameras i have tried from sony just don't feel as sturdy. i trust this a lot more. 

some drawbacks:
1. less lens options than most. panasonic and sigma offer a lot of lenses but with sony and panasonic m43 the choices are almost limitless. i never feel like i can find my perfect lens. 

2. using an external monitor takes the display info from the on camera monitor. i have to use 2 monitors instead of one so i can see the display info on the front and back monitors. i often shoot by myself and film myself so i need to see what's happening. i wish panasonic would fix this so it displays on the in camera monitor and the external monitor. 

other than that i don't really have any serious complaints. i've never had a camera that came so close to doing everything i need. i hope that in the years to come panasonic and sigma offer a ton more lenses and the next firmware update gives me dual display read out and life will be perfect. this really is a once in a decade kind of camera. i've never seen anything like it.

category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment: this camera is great.  the pics are beautiful, file size nice, easy to navigate, a great camera.  however, the eye piece is very close to the top line of the menu, so can be hard to select.  also, i had the r6 and upgraded and the r6 is better in low light than this.  (higher mp essentially has some drawbacks).  also, i do miss the two memory card slots, dont have the new expensive cards yet, but i guess i will invest.  also, in sports photography i have noticed sometimes it can be "busy" loading onto card and i have had to wait.  the speed of the card should be fast enough, but not always.  overall, a fantastic camera.  i'd change a thing or two but i am very happy with the upgrade from r6.  but low light could be better.

review_comment: this camera was very nice for the price and a pretty decent entry-level camera for amateurs and enthusiast. i got mines on sale and saved some money and i definitely would advice getting the warranty and buying some protective gear for it. i got this camera for a trip to michigan and came back with great pictures. the battery life on the camera was pretty good i only had to charge it once the whole trip.  it took a bit messing around with it to get use to controls but after watching a few videos it made more sense. only sucky part was that the camera did not come with an sd card so you have to make sure you buy one.

name: "lg - 55"" class g3 series oled evo 4k uhd smart webos tv with one wall design (2023)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment:
pros:
- bright and color accurate(with some problems)
- best tv software out there
- good image processing
- plenty of input and output
- best oled 
- most customizable settings for best picture quality
- better vrr flicker than others
cons:
- only 100mbps ethernet in the 4k era
- artificial limitations that hurt video quality for gamers and pc users(peak brightness limitations in game mode)
- color volume is not the best compared to qd oled meaning colors are not the most accurate at higher brightness
- vrr flicker (issue with all oleds that somehow is not fixed)
- terrible speakers
- optical audio issue with stuttering
- no 3.5mm headphone jack

name: "sunbritetv - veranda series 43"" class led outdoor full shade 4k uhd tv (2018)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment: we purchased the sunbrite outdoor tv april of last year 2022. due to a very cold we winter the tv was covered and not in use. in june we had the tv on then it just died. i called sunbrite to find out what my options were. 2 months past the warranty. they were nice enough to not charge for parts. however, another company was sent to repair it. without knowing the problem they brought two boards to replace the one in the tv. red flag. when the tech opened it he commented how clean and dry the unit was. it had also been covered all through winter. he replaced the board with a new one and the tv did not work. he then replaced it with yet another board. that one did work. i called sunbrite to see about getting back some or all of the $350 we had to pay up front for the repair. obviously it was a manufacture defect. the customer service rep was very nice and had to see about getting approval from his supervisor. the request was denied. i wasn’t happy about this. the tv had been used less than ten hours. my advice would be to add the protection plan but i’m not too happy that a $1900 tv didn’t even last over 10 hours.

category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: i didn't love it and i didn't hate it.
review_comment:
i didn't love it and i didn't hate it.  took a little getting used to the viewfinder.  what i didn't like with the new technology - i have to upgrade my camera lenses, pocket wizards etc - i also didn't love that it was packed poorly by best buy - and i returned it - it has some issues.  had to eat a restocking fee on top of it.  the box inside the box was bounced all over on it's way to here.  unpressed with their customer service and even trying to get to a person.  a camera that is almost 5k should be packed better than this was....i would recommend the camera but not from best buy.

the camera itself takes a little getting used to with the focus buttons as well - i watched a variety of videos and everyone does things differently.  i'm going to stick with my 5d4 for now - and if i did buy this it would not be here!

name: "sony - 42"" class bravia xr a90k oled 4k uhd smart google tv (2022)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_title: the best tv you can get if you're limited to 42"
review_comment:
i have an a9g master 77" in the living room and wanted everything it offers but in a smaller size as the bedroom tv.  we have a tv armoire that can accepts a tv no larger than a 42" panel.  i sat there staring longingly at the 48" knowing it was just an inch or two too wide and then the 42" dropped.

unlike the 10 year-old panel this replaced there are no rca analog outs to feed my ancient audio system in the bedroom.  this was easily remedied with a spdif->rca box and setting the speaker output to pcm.  yes the built-in speaker/panel setup these have is curiously good for what it is, but actual speakers and an actual subwoofer will win hands down.

i didn't even consider the lg, everything else in the household is google ecosystem and this meshes nicely.

name: sony - alpha a7 iii mirrorless 4k video camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: best camera for norther lights video and photos
review_comment:
the best camera, surpassing sony a74, and capturing mesmerizing northern lights in 4k!

as an avid photographer and videographer, i can confidently say that the sony alpha a7 iii mirrorless 4k video camera is hands down the best camera i've ever used. not only does it outshine its successor, the sony a74, in various aspects, but it also proved to be a game-changer in capturing the breathtaking northern lights in alaska.

let's start with the image and video quality – simply phenomenal! the full-frame 24.2mp sensor delivers stunningly sharp and detailed images with a wide dynamic range that perfectly captures the vibrant colors and subtle nuances of the northern lights. the ability to shoot in 4k resolution ensures that i can relive the mesmerizing light show with unparalleled clarity, making every frame an awe-inspiring visual treat.

one of the standout features that put the alpha a7 iii ahead of the a74 is its advanced autofocus system. with an impressive 693 phase-detection af points and 425 contrast-detection af points, the camera's autofocus is lightning-fast, accurate, and reliable. during the unpredictable northern lights display, this feature proved invaluable in locking onto the dancing lights swiftly, ensuring that i never missed a captivating moment.

when capturing the northern lights, stability is crucial, and the alpha a7 iii excels in this area with its outstanding in-body image stabilization (ibis). the ibis system significantly reduces camera shake during handheld shooting, allowing me to focus on framing the perfect shots without worrying about blur. this feature proved to be a game-changer, especially when i needed to adjust my composition quickly to capture the ever-changing dance of the lights.

the alpha a7 iii's build quality is top-notch, making it well-suited for outdoor adventures, including capturing the northern lights in chilly alaskan nights. the weather-sealed magnesium alloy body offers peace of mind, knowing that the camera can handle various environmental conditions without any issues.

another aspect where the alpha a7 iii triumphs over the a74 is battery life. during my northern lights expeditions, i relied on the camera's impressive battery performance, allowing me to shoot for extended periods without interruption. this was essential for capturing the magical moments of the northern lights display without having to worry about running out of power.

in conclusion, the sony alpha a7 iii mirrorless 4k video camera is, without a doubt, the best camera i've ever had the pleasure of using. its outstanding image and video quality, lightning-fast autofocus, remarkable in-body image stabilization, and long-lasting battery performance make it superior to the a74 and other competitors in its class. my experience capturing the northern lights in 4k was nothing short of exceptional, and the alpha a7 iii's capabilities allowed me to immortalize those extraordinary moments in all their splendor. if you're seeking a camera that excels in both photography and videography and is perfect for capturing the wonders of nature like the northern lights, the sony alpha a7 iii is the ultimate choice that will exceed all your expectations.

name: canon - eos r7 mirrorless camera with rf-s18-150mm f/3.5-6.3 is stm lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras

name: canon - eos rebel t7 dslr video two lens kit with ef-s 18-55mm and ef 75-300mm lenses - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, DSLR Cameras, DSLR Body & Lens
review_comment: we upgraded from our current dslr from it dying after so many years.  my wife sells stuff online, and was using her phone in the mean time until we got a new camera.  this is the camera we purchased.  it is amazing.  my only issues with it are stuff that were already known before purchasing, so i can not knock it down for those issues.  they are not issues, but wifi transfer is not a thing, and the lens that is comes with is not a far zoom lens which you should know before you even decide to purchase a camera.  the bad it comes with is great quality as well.  battery life is great.  we ended up getting a battery adapter to have it plugged into the wall though since we use it in the same spot, so it made sense in our situation to go that route, but for on the go, the battery life is indeed good.  if you are new to dslr, just read the manual and watch some videos online about what each setting does, so you are well versed in what the camera can do.

name: "sony - 48"" class bravia xr a90k oled 4k uhd smart google tv (2022)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment: i own an earlier version of this tv and bought this panel as a gift for for a friend's small studio apt. if you need a modest sized tv for a bedroom or small space and don't want a lot of fussy cords, sound bar, etc., then i think this is virtually a perfect tv. it has a discreet oval stand and 1/4" bezel for a super clean look. the screen vibrates to create the sound (and it's surprisingly good...), it handles room light reflections better than most tv's. the operating system has been upgraded since i bought mine and it's more streamlined as is the remote. the settings are easier to access, as well. if you mostly stream movies and tv shows this is an ideal tv. it does have a nextgen tuner for 4k broadcast signals, however, if you have access to a rooftop antenna. it may not be the best set for gaming, overall, but those who do game will know which panels they favor. i've had my a90 for 18 months now and enjoy it more and more as time goes on; it's subtly seductive. i calibrated mine with calman although i think sony calibrates their top tv's at the factory; it was quite good right out of the box, with settings at less than 5% off the mark. it easily calibrated to within 1%, however, and is even more balanced. highly recommended!

review_title: lg g3 oled with mla to take on qd-oled
review_comment: lg did a good job with g3 by implementing mla and color boost algorithms that uses extra pixel brightness to compensate for loss of color luminosity compared to qd-oled.

name: sony - zv1 ii 20.1-megapixel digital camera for content creators and vloggers - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Point & Shoot Cameras
review_comment: the sony zv-1 ii vlog camera is every content creators dream! its compact enough to fit in your pocket and lightweight for ease of use on the go. i was surprised at how user friendly navigation was. the ultra wide lens makes it easy to get everything you need within your shot and the zoom lever is a nice touch making a smooth transition zooming in and out. there are so many different settings in the menu so you can get that perfect looking video/image you need. i especially like the soft skin effect when recording my vlogs to enhance my skin tone and smooth out my facial flaws. even in low lit enviroments i was able to get a clear image. auto focusing works flawlessly and 4k video quality is top notch as well as the directional audio that goes with it. even walking while recording the stabilization is buttery smooth, vlogging and content creation is never halted by busy schedules, travel or finding the right environment. sonys creators app worked wonderfully allowing me to quickly transfer images, and videos wirelessly from the camera to my phone without hassle. overall, i highly recommend this camera whether you're a professional or beginner and it's the perfect go-to for your content creating needs especially at this price point.

name: sony - alpha 7s iii full-frame mirrorless camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment:
the sony a7s iii paired with my 24-70mm gm lens is a dynamic duo that sets new standards in the world of photography and videography. this combination delivers exceptional performance, making it an ideal choice for both professionals and enthusiasts seeking top-tier results.

the a7s iii's standout feature is its remarkable low-light capabilities, thanks to its impressive 12.1-megapixel full-frame sensor. this camera excels in capturing stunning details even in challenging lighting conditions, making it a game-changer for night photography and indoor shoots. its 4k video recording at up to 120fps ensures silky-smooth motion and impeccable clarity, while the 16-bit raw output elevates the possibilities for post-production editing.

paired with the 24-70mm gm lens, the a7s iii reaches new heights of versatility. the lens's wide aperture range of f/2.8 allows for breathtaking bokeh and exceptional subject isolation. its sharpness across the focal range ensures impeccable image quality, whether you're capturing landscapes, portraits, or events. the fast and accurate autofocus system guarantees that you never miss a crucial moment, while the rugged build of both the camera and lens ensures they're ready to withstand the demands of professional use.

in conclusion, the sony a7s iii coupled with the 24-70mm gm lens is a powerhouse combination that delivers stunning image quality, remarkable low-light performance, and unparalleled creative control. whether you're a seasoned professional or an avid enthusiast, this duo is poised to elevate your photographic and cinematic endeavors to new heights.

name: sony - alpha a7 iii mirrorless 4k video camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: a very capable performer at a reasonable price!
review_comment:
let's be honest.  if you are considering the sony a7 iii in 2023, you are not buying it because it represents leading edge technology.  then why buy it (especially since i currently own a sony a7r ii and a sony a7r iva)?  the answer is simple - i was looking for a replacement for the sony a7r ii. the a7r ii is a good system but the battery that it uses is really bad - compared to the battery found in the a7 iii and higher sony cameras, it offers less than half the shots per battery. further, the features offered by the a7 iii, while not cutting edge, are still more than adequate for what i was looking for - a travel camera.  

with the drop in price due a best buy sale and the fact that many of the a7 iii accessories such as the battery grip have dropped greatly in price have made this camera an attractive purchase.  

i have already used it and i am pleased with its results. so, if you are looking for a reasonably priced, high quality camera that gives you access to the sony, tamron, and sigma lenses (which are far larger than those found for fujifilm, canon mirrorless, and nikon mirrorless), then this camera offers a very compelling value proposition.

name: sony - zv-1f vlog camera for content creators and vloggers - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Point & Shoot Cameras
review_comment: i've really liked using the sony zv-1f so far. there seems to be a lot of opinions about it out there on the internet but as someone who wanted a good camera that took photos and videos but doesn't know too much about cameras themselves, it's a perfect fit. the set up is pretty easy and there aren't so many settings that you'll be overwhelmed. there's a button for recording a video and a button for taking a still image without you having to switch back and forth between the two, which is such a nice feature. it also comes with a windmuff. other cameras were just way too big and complicated for my needs, so this seems to be the best of both worlds - in my budget and exactly what i needed as a beginner (though i don't imagine i will ever buy a bigger camera).

name: sony - cyber-shot rx100 vii 20.1-megapixel digital camera - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Point & Shoot Cameras
review_comment: i have a passion for live music performances, and i'm always on the lookout for a reliable camera that can capture the essence of the moment. luckily, i've stumbled upon a game-changing device that ticks all the boxes. what sets it apart is its versatility - it's allowed in both local theaters and massive stadiums. but that's not all; with 20.1 megapixels and an f-stop of 2.8, it produces stunning, high-quality images that are sure to impress. another perk is its compact size - measuring just 2.3 inches in height, 4 inches in width, and 1.7 inches in depth, and weighing only 272.1 grams - it's incredibly easy to carry around. whether you're in the front row or up in the nosebleeds, you can rest assured that you'll capture all the action with stunning clarity and precision with this camera. this camera boasts a touch screen that rotates a full 180 degrees, making it the ideal tool for capturing those perfect selfies. the audio quality is nothing short of exceptional, while its video quality at 4k, 30fps is truly impressive. however, i have noticed that the lens may retract slowly when turning off the camera, which can be somewhat problematic when one is in a rush to store it away. in my personal experience as a fellow enthusiast, i wholeheartedly advocate for this particular camera model as the ultimate all-in-one option that can fulfill all of your photography needs. examples of pictures taken can be found in instgram @zamorraaaa.

category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_title: happy with tv but details on specs would be great.
review_comment:
very happy with tv.  lack of information is troubling.
i have to say it worked right out the box and was very happy with picture.  sound was good but added a jbl sounbar which eaily worked with e-arc.

upscaling is very good .

questions:

1.  the specs say there is no atsc 3.0 ( nextgen tuner) but other sources say that there is.  it is hard to get the right information. not a deal killer but keep that it mind if you want local channels.

2. atsc 3.0 compatible is not an answer any tv is atsc3.0 compatible if you add a tuner. a  definitive answer would be good,  best buy says 3.0 atsc tuner when you chat with them

3. the remote is mediocre.  the apps work on sony and are sluggish.  but they work ( which means one less box to clutter up the living room),  

4 it is really hard to find information and reviews about this model   for example, how to access the service menu on the tv.

5. it is 2023 model but i dont know how it compares with the now discounted 2022 models.

so no regrets and very happy with  picture but better information would be helpful

review_comment:

name: furrion - 50” partial sun 4k uhd smart outdoor tv (2023)
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment: very solid tv and the 50" is actually very large for our patio area. i'm glad i didn't go bigger.  i went ahead and purchased the top end mounting bracket that actually swivels out around one of the house beams that is beside our swim spa.  we can leave it folded up on the mount and watch from our patio area or swivel it out and watch it from our spa.  it has amazing speakers that at half the volume would bother my family in the house or maybe the neighbors.  amazing brightness and the 4k is absolutely stunning.  great all around purchase.  the only item i would like to see them upgrade is their app program to a roku or fire stick.  i was able to use my cable xfinity stream ap to get all my channels.  you will have to add a firestick to get the additional aps.

name: "sunbritetv - veranda 3 series 55"" class led outdoor full shade 4k uhd smart android tv (2022)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment: beware! i’d give this 0 stars if i could. in fact, i should be compensated for the hefty bill i paid to have this useless thing mounted and the huge ordeal this purchase has caused - so it actually deserves negative. i received a defective one that absolutely refused to connect to wifi. we bought 3 wifi extenders to place around our house thinking maybe the connection was weak. finally i chat with best buy support who basically brushed me off and told me to contact the manufacturer. i get in touch with sunbrite and they confirm the tv is defective. aside from the fact that i received a lemon, this tv is completely useless. i bought a full shade one because my roof extends over the patio area that i mounted the tv. the sun doesn’t touch it. yet there is still a blinding glare that covers the tv - even at night… the tv would need to be indoors to be usable. it shouldn’t even be considered an outdoor tv because no matter how shaded the area is, the glare will find it. i took a photo of the glare on the tv at 7:45pm during overcast to show how bad it is even when it’s not sunny in the slightest. i also took a photo from the inside of my house during 12pm to show that the sun still doesn’t hit the lanai during peak hours with no clouds in the sky. unless you feel like wasting ~$2,460 (after tax), i’d stay far away from this product. of course i didn’t pull it out of the box within the 15 day return window because i had to hire someone to mount it to my house. i didn’t expect best buy to sell me a faulty product that wouldn’t even function how it should even if it wasn’t a defective one.

review_comment: one of the best camera from sony. perfect for video film maker and photography

name: nikon - z 30 4k mirrorless camera with nikkor z dx 16-50mm f/3.5-6.3 vr lens - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: if it just didnt overheat so quickly
review_comment: dont get this camera if you plan on doing long continuous shoots. it overheats quite fast with 4k 30fps settings, about 20 mins. 1080p 120 fps about the same time. you can get a little under 2 hrs with 1080p 30 fps. quality of the image is solid though. just wished to do long sessions with 4k. and i have the kingston canva react plus sd card and thats a fast card built for video. so its mainly the camera overheating. the auto tracking, image stabilization, and on board microphone are fantastic though. the only minor gripe would be that i wished the lcd screen flipped to the top like the sonys bc having it come out of the side gets in the way of the production i want to do but it probably wont bother others.

name: "samsung - 65"" class the terrace series led outdoor partial sun 4k uhd smart tizen tv (2020)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment:
we’ve had the terrace tv installed for over a year now. it’s installed on our back deck with only a small overhang of the roof of our house over it as well as the soft cover we purchased to protect it. the tv is has great picture and sound quality regardless of when it’s being used (mainly at night and all through the day on fall saturdays for college football). we have zero problems with glare or picture.

we also have heavy winds, snow and at times hail where we live and have never had any damage to the tv. it is definitely built well for inclement weather. we just make sure to keep the terrace cover over it when not using but nothing substantial protecting it from the elements.

we did purchase a sound bar to go with the tv but due to shipping delays we were about a month without it. the sound bar is great but a nice to have. it’s really not needed for this tv. the sound and picture quality of the tv itself is fine on its own.

name: canon - powershot v10 4k video 20.9-megapixel digital camera for vloggers and content creators - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Point & Shoot Cameras
review_comment: i absolutely loved this camera for the first month. i brought it everywhere. it slowly began taking over some of my tediously bulky gear. i was so happy. fast forwrd to today. i am at a shoot, i hand the camera to the client so rhey can get pov footage and take some candids with it as it is so easy to use. the camera took some images and froze. screen is on on but blank, none of the buttons or touch screen will respond. called canon, they invited me to call back tuesday. best buy says on my profile i have now missed the return window. i bought it july 26 and the return window apparently ended august 10th. so now i am stuck with a state of art paperweight neither cannon nor best buy will stand behind. i highly recommed rhe canon v10 if you want to get incredibly frustrated, upset your clients, feel like you got duped. i have included an shot of the powershot doing what it does best, holding down paper from breezes. a rock does the same and will not cause the frustration buying a canon v10 from best buy will. save your money and run!

name: "insignia™ - 32"" class f20 series led full hd smart fire tv"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_title: tv is great if you don't need to use earbuds.
review_comment:
i had the same tv but in a 24" and loved it.  the bluetooth connection with my earbuds worked flawlessly.  i moved that tv to where my treadmill is and decided to get a bit bigger one for my office.  in comes the 32" with all the same features as my 24". 

after having my earbuds connected to the new 32" tv for approx 20 minutes or so, the sound starts sounding garbled. i thought i needed new earbuds.  i then tried a different brand of earbuds i had, new just a few months ago and hardly used, and sure enough, started doing the same thing. 

i took the tv back and got another exact same tv.  thinking it must have been that tv and possibly had a glitch or not made correctly.  nope, the second tv is now doing the same thing.  i will be taking this one back and going to a different brand.

name: lg - 55” class ur9000 series led 4k uhd smart webos tv (2023)
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment:
overall, i'm satisfied with the tv. i'm not a tv buff, but i'm glad i decided to upgrade from my measly 32" hdtv to this one for my living room. i hadn't notice i was straining my eyes watching the my old tv until i watched shows on this one.

it's a good product for the price. it has good streaming presets so it's ready to go out of box. setup and product registration was easy. i chose this one over a 50" sony that was not as thin as the lg and was a comparable price. 

the only minor downside is the gestural mode on the remote that happens when you click on the wheel ball. that's not a helpful feature.

name: canon - eos rebel t7 dslr video two lens kit with ef-s 18-55mm and ef 75-300mm lenses - black
