name: lg - 55” class ur9000 series led 4k uhd smart webos tv (2023)
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment: my family and i recently went tv shopping. we haven’t needed one since 2017, however my kids decided to throw balls across the room and damaged my samsung 55” tv. we went shopping here and found the lg 55ur90 with ai assist. i thought with this being our first 4k tv ai assist may help. after opening the box and laying everything on the floor, i noticed a size difference between my current tv and the new one (lg55ur90). i got my measuring tape out again and measured my damaged samsung 55” tv. it measured 55” screen id. i measured the lg 55” screen id and it measured 48”. imagine my amazement and anger as i checked the box. right there it says in bold writing 55” tv 54.4” screen. the box vs what it actually is was a total lie. i contacted lg and they told me rest assured that “our 55” tv’s are defaulted at (48”)”…i told them that was seven inches of lies. it is! everyone may read this and laugh, but it’s a pain having to pack this tv back up. i’m taking it back to best buy, because this is the last night lg is back in my house. ps. the tv is so small now we can pack it into a jeep. which says a lot when it comes to a tv.

name: lg - stanbyme 27” class led full hd smart webos touch screen (2022)
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment:
i bought this because i moved to an apartment with a large terrace so i thought this would be good for temporary outdoor use. turns out it's really useful in lots of situations in addition to outdoor use. i use it in the kitchen for background music or video. it's also really handy to have a large portable screen for youtube playback for repair instructions around the apartment.

i really wish this was a full android tablet instead though. the apps in the lg store are somewhat limited and many of the apps that do exist don't actually work with the touchscreen. lg created a virtual remote control which works fine but a large android tablet wouldn't have that problem and would have many more media apps as well.

also, picture quality is fine but 4k would've been nice to have.

overall, i'm happy with the purchase and i'm glad lg is willing to take a risk on unexpected form factors like this.

name: "sony - 75"" class bravia xr x90l led 4k uhd smart google tv (2023)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment:
cons: viewing angles are not that good. my old 2019 tcl 6 series was much better in that regard. not enough local dimming zones which means you will see some blooming. it's not bad though. sound quality is not that good. get a sound bar. 

pros: brightness is excellent. colors are accurate. processing of certain 1080p media is amazing. when the tv detects media playback, it uses its local blooming which means black levels are pretty good. it's a great overall tv when calibrated. not as bright as its competition, but you get accuracy in return.

name: "sony - 65"" class bravia xr x90l led 4k uhd smart google tv (2023)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_title: sony 65" class bravia xr x90l led 4k uhd smart goo
review_comment:
the sony 65" class bravia xr x90l led 4k uhd smart google tv has redefined my home entertainment experience. from its sleek design to its cutting-edge technology, every aspect of this tv has left me thoroughly impressed.

the 4k uhd display is nothing short of breathtaking. the xr cognitive processor provides an unrivaled level of detail, and the colors are vivid and true to life. whether i'm watching movies, gaming, or streaming my favorite shows, the clarity and depth of the visuals are consistently outstanding.

the integration of google tv elevates the smart features to a whole new level. the interface is intuitive, and the vast array of apps and streaming services at my fingertips ensures that i never run out of content to enjoy. the google assistant functionality adds a layer of convenience, allowing me to control the tv with simple voice commands.

the audio quality is equally impressive, thanks to the acoustic multi-audio technology. the sound is immersive, clear, and well-balanced, enhancing the overall viewing experience. whether it's a quiet dialogue or an action-packed scene, the audio reproduction is top-notch.

the build quality of the sony bravia xr x90l is exceptional. the slim bezels and premium materials not only contribute to its aesthetic appeal but also showcase sony's commitment to quality craftsmanship. the tv feels sturdy and durable, reflecting the brand's reputation for reliability.

connectivity options are abundant, accommodating all my devices seamlessly. the inclusion of hdmi ports, usb slots, and bluetooth capabilities ensures that i can effortlessly connect and enjoy content from various sources.

in summary, the sony 65" class bravia xr x90l led 4k uhd smart google tv is a masterpiece of television technology. its combination of stunning visuals, user-friendly interface, immersive audio, and robust build quality make it a standout choice for those seeking a premium home entertainment solution. sony has once again set the bar high, delivering a tv that exceeds expectations on every front.

name: "sony - 65"" class x80k led 4k uhd smart google tv (2023)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_comment:
i bought this tv after i had moved out and had to leave my older generation sony bravia 55 inch. i got that tv on with a insane deal but i really liked it. do to my experience with that tv i decided to upgrade to the newer 65'. overall this tv keeps the things i loved about the older generation and improves on other things.

image:  this tv had a great picture. decent brightness, vivid colors, and very solid and dark blacks. to my eyes this is tv is close to as good as you can get without spending way more for some of the newer display technologies like oled, mini led, etc. don't take my word for it though once you get into "good" tvs you really should be going to the store and seeing them for yourself, what will edge out what you like more is going to be personal preference.

sound: based on personal preference i like the sound on this tv, what is objective is this tv is loud. i've never even put it up as high as 50%. for me this is a huge bonus because i've never felt it was necessary to get a sound bar. if you aren't planning on doing a surround sound setup and you just want good clean stereo audio without the headaches that tend to come with a sound bar i can definitely recommend this tv. 

physical design: this is a good looking tv, bezels are thin, the included stands are simple and unobtrusive. and there are no obnoxious leds on the front that will light up a dark room. other than that, not much to say

remote:  i honestly love this remote. not a bunch of unnecessary buttons, it isn't too big, the buttons don't click but they do have a positive feeling press that makes it clear when you've actuated the button. the biggest thing i like about it though the fact that it doesn't use ir as it's wireless technology, because you don't have to point it at the tv, button presses are super reliably registered, even when i in the next room in the kitchen while having spotify, or youtube playing.

software: i really like google/android tv it is simple and easy to navigate while still being able to let you dig in a bit. for example it's nice that i can go into settings and force stop applications that are having problems so i can restart them without having to fully restart the tv. and on more basic things, this tv is going to have all of your standard streaming apps available.

really the only negative i can say about this tv would be the price. while i happily paid full price for this tv and do not regret it in the slightest, i also recognize that there are better deals out there. so if price is your biggest factor this may not be for you. but if this seems like a reasonable price to you and you are happy with everything else i can recommend it. if you can get it on a sale then it's a no brainer.

name: canon - eos r6 mark ii mirrorless camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_comment: i personally enjoy going to best  buy off hospitality lane  in san bernardino.  i’m always confused buying camera equipment for my fiancée. but, due  to the great customer service and patience that i get every time i leave feeling confident knowing he will enjoy the gift i’m bringing home to him. i appreciate the great service and the time explaining making sure i know what i just purchased. a little bit goes a long way and i value that.

name: "roku - 55"" class plus series qled 4k smart rokutv"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_title: issue with repeating when using live tv
review_comment:
we had a tcl roku tv and loved the roku feature and ability to pause live tv. sadly the tv stopped working. we replaced with a 55” roku brand tv. the tv has many great features and is easy to use. my biggest issue is that this tv constantly repeats when you are watching live tv. this happens when you have a memory stick in the usb port. watching shows and the news is annoying when the tv keeps repeating lines and then garbles the sound to catch up. i have contacted roku support twice. the first time i was asked to do some simple fixes and see if they worked. they did not so i called back. my issue was escalated to their engineering department. unfortunately, there’s nothing that i can do as far as a return. the issue started about 20-25 days after the purchase. now it’s too lat to return. i asked the roku rep what they would do and they indicated that engineering had to look into it. this may se like a minor issue to some, but it is annoying. the only way to eliminate the issue is to remove the memory stick. this also disables the “pause live tv” option that is a main feature of the roku tv. 

at this point i don’t know that i can recommend this tv. i love the concept and ease of use. i just can’t stand the constant repeating when watching live tv.

review_comment: we had not intended to purchase a 42" tv when we came to best buy looking for a new internet router. when we saw the fire tvs stacked in a near-by aisle,  the high quality of the display, and the price point, we bought one to put under the christmas tree. we loved it, with the resolution being several notches above our previous larger screen tv and we loved the amazon prime offerings we were able to view on the tv by virtue of our amazon prime membership. things were so good in fact, we returned 3 days later to purchase another one  smaller in size that fit perfectly under our kitchen cabinet.

name: "sony - 77"" class bravia xr a80l oled 4k uhd smart google tv (2023)"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_title: great tv and awesome premium feature set
review_comment:
i love the tv.

this is an upgrade from a previous bravia model (xbr55-950d) which finally bit the dust after several years of use.

the upgrade was well worth it. the colors are great on anything i'm watching or doing. whether it's streaming, live tv/sports, playing ps5, or using it as a secondary monitor for my laptop it just pops.

there is some configuration you have to do to the hdmi inputs to make sure it's displaying at the resolution and frame-rate you want, but that's pretty standard for most tv brands.

interface is easy to navigate (google tv), setup was easy.

one feature i see only available on premium tvs and that isn't given too much attention is the ability to turn off the display and have only audio come out.

this isn't as prevalent anymore since you can effectively play music from a bunch of devices, but i find it really nice if i want to play a youtube playlist or long form music stream without the display being on.

while the onboard speakers are decent, i do recommend either an external sound bar or sound system in conjunction with the built-in's to get a great sound experience.

name: sony - alpha 6700 - aps-c mirrorless camera (body only) - black
category_path: Best Buy, Cameras, Camcorders & Drones, Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras
review_title: for the price, its a great camera.
review_comment:
the camera is great. great quality photo and video. 
its not the best apsc in terms of specs. fuji offers much better resolution,  and video capabilities. 
but, its an all around good camera. no negatives that ive noticed. 
as a professional award winning photographer and filmmaker whose made a feature film, i'd recommend this as a great travel camera, or back up b cam, especially if you use sony full frame cameras,  as the lens mount is the same. 

at its price it isnt fair to compare it to more expensive, premium apsc cameras. and having said that it doesn't punch above its class. i'd argue that sony typically overcharges for their offerings. but, value can be found in the overall system. 
its just great for what it is. 
if your looking for more than this offers, check out fuji xh2/2s... they cost more. but, they are absolute beasts. i use an xh2 professionally. 40mp, 8k pro res internal,  and i've never had issues. purchased this as a travel camera for times i dont want to carry more expensive and larger gear.

name: "roku - 55"" class select series 4k smart rokutv"
category_path: Best Buy, TV & Home Theater, TVs, All Flat-Screen TVs
review_title: grear tv with a few known bugs not resolved.
review_comment: i want a working product !!!!!! i looked forward to the roku tv / streamer device that does not come with known issues that kept me from using a just purchased jbl 2.1 deep bass sound bar. not compatible.... returned and went back to 43" sharp 4k / roku tv that is 5 years old with a better picture than the new roku plus series. i am overall not happy with a lot of the current 55" tvs. i purchased and returned a roku 55" plus series. not compatible with just purchased jbl sound bar. also a samsung 55" qled, funky display. seemed to be doing a bad job at adjusting to amount of light in room. returned..... hisense 55" seemed to have the best picture but had other problems,  sound bar compatibility and some basic design flaws. seems these vendors did a real rush job getting to market that it seems like most manufacturers screwed up. roku already claiming the new qled 55" model will have all fixes done for release. there is something wrong with all 55" models in general struggling to stay ahead but no one is. i'm back to my 43" sharp 4k uhd/roku tv and love it even more following the trying of 3 different 55" new models which did not work even close to my expectations. simple, just not compatible with programming problems that should have been accomplished before releasing the model.
